It uses the built in gps to detect how far you've turned the camera, and any change of orientation, and automatically snaps the picture when the camera is turned at the right angle.  It guides you to the right position on screen.  The camera then combines the images together automatically, allowing you to see what it looks like.  It takes some time, to put them togather, but this is the best way to take panoramics I've seen.A couple other notes, it requires the olympus proprietary usb connector, which is a pain, but not the worst.  It's not the most beautiful camera, but looks a lot better than other tought cameras.  We only tested the waterproof to about 10 feet, so I can't judge further, but it was salt water, and there were no problems.At the end of the day, if you're looking for a rugged camera that takes great pictures you'll want to show off, this is the one to go with.  The photo's aren't SLR quality, but they are great quality.  You don't have to worry about breaking the camera, and it wont weigh you down.  We are super happy we made this investment.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus TG-2 iHS Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD...
Reviews.Author: Vickie Maslowski
Reviews.Content: WOW.. The Olympus Stylus TG-2 iHS is an amazing underwater camera! We just got back from a wonderful vacation and took our Olympus with us to go swimming in Grand Cayman Islands and Cozumel Mexico the pictures came out clear as if we were still underwater! My husband and I love this camera so much cant wait to go underwater again!  Thank you Olympus for making a GREAT underwater camera!

Reviews.Title: After 32 days of use - Noticed major defect - broken.
Reviews.Author: Ivar J Kljavin / MS-50
Reviews.Content: A nice gift - but unfortunately, after 32 days - a loud fast clicking noise can be heard coming from the camera audible to the human ear and thus recorded on any video taken.  Missed the 30 days return with Amazon :(.  Most likely this camera out of 1000's has a defect - otherwise a good camera I think.

Reviews.Title: The audible noise over the videos is almost fixed, compared to TG-1 ihs model.
Reviews.Author: Mehrashk Meidani
Reviews.Content: I returned my TG-1 ihs for the annoying noise on its videos. Apart from that, TG-1 was the best outdoors camera I have ever had. Reading the negative reviews about the same problem with this new model, made me a bit nervous because I had already ordered the camera. When I received it, the first thing I tested was that ticking noise on the videos. The noise problem is almost fixed, both in IS mode on or off. If you record in a very silent room, and the point of focus is changed, or the camera shakes, you may notice a very low un-annoying noise on the videos. Only those who want to hear it, will hear it.The super macro mode, the new feature, is amazing.The autofocus works very fast and smooth in regular indoor lighting.HDR feature is very good and useful.I recommend this hardcore camera to everyone, either outdoor adventurer or regular vacation photographer. It is a good investment.

Reviews.Title: POS Dial
Reviews.Author: JasonF
Reviews.Content: There is a dial on the back of the camera that is used to select various settings (i.e. magic, iauto, c1, c2...).  Attached to this dial is a label with the setting.  This first time (approximately 1 month of owning the camera) I used it in water (at a waterpark), the label fell off.  I called Olympus and got a replacement label (guess what no adhesive was provided to reattach the label to the mechanical dial).  I called Olympus back and was told that the camera really needs to be shipped in for repair (customers are not advised on how to reattach the label to the dial).  Repair time will take 7 business days.  The repair headquarters are located in Texas.  I live in Florida.  Shipping time via UPS ground is 4 days each way.  Thus, this repair will take 15 days minimum. NOT COOL!  The camera is designed to be waterproof.  This should have been thought of when designing the camera.  Naturally, people who buy the camera want to use it in the water.  I fear returning the camera and having the label fall off the next time I go in the water with it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: tracey nicholson
Reviews.Content: Really love the camera! Only 2 cons, there is noise when you record and when recording it might go out of focus and takes a sec to get back in focus.

Reviews.Title: Good all around camera
Reviews.Author: Z Moe "Z Moe"
Reviews.Content: I read reviews for all the rugged style cameras, watched you tube reviews and tests, read more reviews about picture quality and jpeg quality.  I settled on the TG-2 even though it was quite a bit more than the TG-830 because picture quality was from what I could tell a bit better.  I figure if I'm going to really awesome places and take pictures I better get the best picture quality I can in the type of camera I'm purchasing.  We have taken this to the pool, down water slides, and had no leak issues.  I tried a Nikon camera, and although it had good decent picture quality it was not as good, it had a lot of features, but it also leaked in a bath tub.This camera has one big downfall - the dial to change modes is hard to turn, I'm guessing when I am skiing or snowboarding there is no hope to change modes with gloves, and probably even without.  Other than that the lens placement in the middle of the camera instead of towards the top is also a nice advantage, less chance people will put their fingers in front of the picture.

Reviews.Title: super tough
Reviews.Author: orion bradburn
Reviews.Content: This camera takes wonderful pictures and its tough as can be. True story I lost it in the snow while taking pictures, the temperatures were negative 20 and it laid in a foot of snow. I couldn't find it for a week until the snow began to melt. I found it next to the road and had been ran over by countless cars. As soon as i picked it up, it turned on and continued to take excellent pictures. This is a wonderful camera and would suggest it highly to anyone who loves taking pictures and the outdoors. Its Perfect. I love it!

Reviews.Title: bought for scuba diving
Reviews.Author: mac
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from a local shop as a upgrade for my olympus tough TG1.I was a little worried at first to use it underwater because the housing I ordered hasn't arrived yet. This camera is rated at 50 feet depth so I was cautious not to dive deeper than that. I removed 1 star because when I tried to use super macro the camera focus seems to hunt & unable to focus on the subject, but when I did at the surface it seems to work fine. I still have to make some adjustments. I'll try it again with underwater housing in my next dive. So far I highly recommend this camera for diving down to 50 feet..Update..A week after diving I removed the red dial at the front of the camera, I found out that there are some signs of oxidation on the 3 tiny screws. I remember I've rinsed it thoroughly & even soaked it in fresh water for a couple of hours to make sure that salts hiding on some cavities can be rinsed. This is definitely an unwelcome news considering that I'm starting to enjoy taking underwater shots. Olympus should have used at least a stainless 316 material for the screws to make sure it will be corrosion resistant.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good cam!
Reviews.Author: Zakatronics
Reviews.Content: I'm a Canon nut but I have to say this Olympus caught me off guard. My first impressions were, wow this thing is built tough and the placement of all the buttons is just right. After using it and going through the menus, I was pretty happy. Very user friendly, pics it took were really high quality and I used it under some adverse conditions while in the desert dune bashing etc... Long story short, pretty good cam!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera - Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Kateson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in March when it first came out. I was looking for a durable underwater camera.Since March I have used it a handful of times and I am not impressed. I understand that when you choose an underwater camera you lose some quality. However, it takes horrible pictures whether you are underwater or not.Half of the time I haven't been able to use the camera because all it does is beep several times and shut off.I sent the camera away once and now I am sending it away a second time because I am still having the same issue.The technical support and customer service at Olympus is a headache. I can never reach someone that I can understand because they all have such strong accents. I finally found someone that I could make out what they were saying. No one answers your questions when you are on the phone with them. They are just silent. They always send me information on where to send it in the US when I am from Canada. It doesn't matter how many times I tell them I am from Canada I had to call back several times to get a shipping address in Canada.I was so excited about this camera and now I am disapointed. I spent a good chunk of money on this camera and can't use it. I was told that they would send me a refurbished camera if they try 3 times to fix it and it doesn't work. It's a brand new camera that has been barely used and the best they can do is a refurbished camera.PLEASE do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Great snorkeling camera somewhat expensive.
Reviews.Author: jerbola
Reviews.Content: have used mostly for snorkeling based underwater photography with good outcome, great with the fisheye telephoto. have not had as much difficulty with viewscreen in bright light as reviews said. color rendition not as good as a canon compact. ,major complaint is lack of flash mode control in many settings, difficult to slave. placement of flash interferes with the wide angle and fisheye lens. finally wheel control is difficult even without gloves slight adjustment of the wheel edge would solve the problem.

Reviews.Title: Can't use video unless use Olympus software
Reviews.Author: bobO "gizmo-guy"
Reviews.Content: I would have not bought this camera had I known that videos taken can only be used with Olympus software.  Will not load to my Adobe Premier, nor play with Windows Media Player.  Cannot utilize videos to combine with my other sources to create DVD.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - even though mine flooded
Reviews.Author: Marc Danziger "Armed Liberal"
Reviews.Content: So I'm writing this as I wait for my TG-2 to be replaced.It flooded when I got Maytagged through a Class IV rapid on the Snake River with it attached to my life vest. Even though it's waterproof - there are limits.I'd used it for three days on the trip up until than, and managed to save the SD card and photos - which were surprisingly excellent.It's small, easy to use, takes great pictures, and quite waterproof as long as you're reasonably close to the surface and it isn't churning too badly.I'd get another one in a minute; just recommended it to a co-worker about to run an adventure race in the jungle in Brazil.

Reviews.Title: TG-2 iHS is great.
Reviews.Author: T. Miller "Sixty"
Reviews.Content: I have two small kids that love playing with my camera.  So, I needed something that was kid proof and high quality.  The Olympus Stylus TG-2 is a great camera.  I’ve used the camera every day for about three months now.  It seems to be indestructible and kid proof.  My little one drops the camera all the time, on the tile floor, in the dirt, etc.  One great feature is the lack of a mechanical shutter.  My kids loved to stick their fingers on the lenses of my canon cameras and open and close the shutters.  It really stands up to their abuse.  As discussed in some of the other reviews, the camera does not take very good pictures in low light.  That’s the only drawback but it wouldn’t stop me from buying an TG-2 again.

Reviews.Title: Failed after 3 days
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: In summary, I’m disappointed with my Olympus TG-2.  Bought the camera for a vacation trip.  Tested it in a pool before going and worked great; no leaks, no problems.  After 3 days on vacation the camera failed.  Wouldn’t take pictures.  The doors didn’t leak.  It just wouldn’t turn on to take pictures.  I could get the GPS tracking to work and used it for that the rest of the trip.  During the first 3 days I went snorkeling once or twice a day to depths of about 10 feet.  The only thing I think I could have done better is more regular rinsing; I may have missed a day.The camera has been repaired by Olympus under warranty.  No issues here, fast turn-around.  Camera is working again.Picture quality seems fair, could be better but I didn’t review the pictures until back home so I may have been able to tweak some settings or my style for better quality.  On the positive side the camera does turn on fast, take pictures quickly, GPS works, and I thought was easy to operate.  I was very happy with it until it failed.Others on my trip bought less expensive cameras, the pictures looked good and their cameras didn’t fail.  Given the price of this camera, I feel I would have been better buying 2 less expensive waterproof cameras.  Then I would have 2 batteries plus a backup camera if the first one fails.  Whatever you do bring a backup regular camera to take “dry” pictures just in case.  I didn’t, thought I had a tough camera.

Reviews.Title: Accessories Disappoint
Reviews.Author: Dennis Bradley Price "yeldarb68"
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is decent enough. However the accessories disappoint.First, the camera doesn't come with a battery charger, you have to charge it in the camera.  There is an AC adapter to connect via USB to the camera and charge the battery that way, but most other brands include a standalone AC battery charger.  The appropriate charger in this case is the $50 Olympus UC-90 USB Battery Charger, which is a USB connection to the battery - you still need the AC/USB device.  Too many parts to carry around and lose!Second, the strap is a flat strap with a wrist loop, but no way to cinch it down tight around your wrist.  This strap is rather useless in water sports or any activity where you don't want the camera to go flying off your wrist.  Zero thought was put into this strap design, apparently.Lastly, while not an accessory comment, I have to say this camera is heavier than it appears.  Heavier than Nikon and Canon waterproof point-and-shoot cameras I have tried.

Reviews.Title: Amazing pictures.  Video is ok.  Everything proof.
Reviews.Author: Gadget Dude "revlisoft"
Reviews.Content: Just received this a few days ago.  Overall the build quality is very good.  A bit on the thicker side but this is a tough series camera.  Overall I liked it alot. Here's a breakdown of the pros and cons.Pros:  - Amazing picture quality.  Close to a DSLR in a compact form.  - Has options for attachment lens  - waterproof, dust proof, etc.  - The red color looks great  - Extremely fast wake up times  - Menus are easy to use and understand  - 1080p video  - Macro mode is exceptional  - GPS enabled  - Great build quality  - Beats out most cameras in different camera comparison like [[...] and well reviewed by dpreview [[...]Cons:  - Should have included an underwater floating strap at this price point.  - Would have liked an automatic close/open cover for the lens but I guess that would make it less sturdy and prone to break.  I think even something manual if I decide to put it in my pocket so I don't smudge the lens would have been a nice addition.  - Videos are good but compared to my sony camcorder it isn't as sharp.  - Opening and closing the cover is a bit of a pain because before you open there's a locking mechanism.  I understand the need for this but it's still annoying.  Sometimes I get confused which order of switches to use first.  - Proprietary charge/transfer cable.  Hello!  It's 2013.  Pick USB or MicroUSB so I don't need to hunt for a dedicated cable when charging or transferring data.

Reviews.Title: Worked as advertised
Reviews.Author: John Gibson
Reviews.Content: Used it in Belize on a diving/snorkel trip. Used it 5 times, twice at around 30 feet. No leaks and beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Failed on first use in ocean
Reviews.Author: Pyogenes
Reviews.Content: Died on first use in the ocean during my honeymoon (Fortunately, I had the foresight to bring multiple camera but only one waterproof one).  As far as I can tell, the water leaked in through the mode dial.  Some really fine sand made it's way in there (I could here grinding) and probably breached the seal.  The battery/SD card compartment was bone dry when I checked.  I tested it multiple times in the sink to ensure it would work in the water which is why I'm convinced it's related to the sand.A weather proof / underwater camera that can't handle a beach is utterly useless in my book.  I should have steered away when I saw others complain about this and foolishly thought it was user error.

Reviews.Title: Not As Good As the Old SW1030
Reviews.Author: D. Miller
Reviews.Content: After beating up my old Olympus SW1030 (still works), I decided to buy the TG-2 after reviewing its specs.  I've been an Olympus man for 40 years, but I need to write them a letter about their "progress".  I've used smaller Olympus models over the years for bicycling and hiking.  The TG-2 suffers in comparison to the SW1030 for my needs.  The new strap is difficult to manipulate compared to the old strap.  The focusing mechanism is slower on the TG-2.  The zoom buttons are smaller on the TG-2 and are difficult to operate compared to the old SW1030, plus, when you get the zoom's attention it is slow to react, then overreacts by zooming to quickly in either direction.  The TG-2 has two different colored lens bezels supplied with it.  It appears purely for aesthetics.  The plastic bezels click on and off.  The problem is that they unclick off too easily.  I've had mine come off on a hike and on a bike ride and now I'm constantly having to check to make sure it's still there.  I don't have large hands, but the grip placement on the camera's body tends to have one of my fingers in a lot of the wide-angle shots.  The menus are more confusing and the multitude of choices sometimes don't make sense.  I can't force the flash on in some settings where I'd like to.  You should be able to control the flash in all modes.  The photos are of high quality, but if I want that kind of quality I'll use my Olympus SLR.  I'm really disappointed with this purchase... the first okay Olympus of many that I've owned.

Reviews.Title: Very good if you need it
Reviews.Author: Chumley
Reviews.Content: I think the biggest factor in whether you will like this camera depends on how you are going to use it.  If you are researching P&S; cameras and just want a bit of extra durability, you will probably be unhappy with this camera given what it costs.  My current cameras are a couple of Canon DSLR's and a P&S; Canon S95 (excellent BTW).  If you can use the "tough" features this is a solid choice for a camera that is durable and useful under normal conditions as well.ProsAlmost instant onVery fast first shotGreat battery life with USB rechargeDouble locked access doorsEasy to keep clean.  A quick rinse or wipe and it looks new.Screen at first seems mediocre, but stays very clean and smudge + glare free.  Easy to see in bright light too.Feels solid and well made, nice strap setup.  Add a carabiner and you can toss it in your pocket and clip it to a belt loop and go anywhere.Video - It's been a problem for some, but I took a video while on a roller coaster and although I wasn't zooming (I could barely film and hang on) there was very little wind noise and voices were crystal clear.  Focus was excellent.  One of the best videos I've seen from this type of camera.ConsA bit bulky if you are used to small cameras.  Underwater or with gloves on this would not be a con.Follow-up shots are not bad but a bit slower than cameras in this price class (using class 10 cards).Even with the 2.0 lens I found low light shots in auto modes a little disappointing.  Like many P&S;'s it seems easily confused as to lighting indoors and some pictures have that high iso noise effect.  Tough to dial it out even when switching to manual settings.  I think there may be a learning curve with it however.  The number of scenes and modes is overkill but there are some specialty ones that do work.  The night lighting mode took great pictures of the electrical parade at Disney.  Even though I have DSLR's I expect P&S;'s to do a good job even on the auto or scene settings.Price.  Overall image quality in normal outdoor lighting situations is good, but not remarkable.  Comparable to some of the better cameras in the $175-$225 range not $350-$400.Overall this is a solid camera. I've taken it to the beach, in the pool, to the frozen north and to Disney.  I have not taken it down 50' or dropped it or stepped on it.  Assuming it is "tough" as advertised,  I think I will enjoy this as a addition camera to take when conditions merit.  Again, I think if you were looking for one camera only, and your need for tough conditions is a nice to have versus any specific need, I'd look elsewhere.  You can almost buy a spare at this price.  If you have a need, none of those cameras will last a day under conditions that this camera shines.

Reviews.Title: An Unexpected Wonder!
Reviews.Author: Giordano Bruno
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in Hawaii, on the spur of the moment, to use while snorkling. I'd used other cameras underwater and I can swear that this one works as well as any ... which is only as well as the water clarity and the persistence of the snorkler allows. I took dozen of shots, almost all of which are just murky mementos of a great vacation. The camera survived hours of underwater time without a scratch or a leak.Meanwhile, I discovered by serendipity that this is a superb pocket camera for above water. Light as it is, the shutter touch is even lighter, making it easier to take hand-held pictures without jiggling. My mini Panasonic, by comparison, demands that It touch the shutter button ever so gingerly; even so, I sometimes take photos of empty space.But the real wonder of this Olympus in its macro settings! Precise focus and excellent depth of field even at a few inches from the subject! Unexcelled for hand-held shots of flowers, insects, keyholes, tattoos, whatever!

Reviews.Title: Do not believe the high reviews of this junk camera
Reviews.Author: Sherry G
Reviews.Content: I did, I succumbed to the online reviews stating this was the best way to go with a compact underwater camera. My boyfriend, who is a professional photographer, told me I would regret buying it. He was so opposed to me buying an Olympus he threatened to leave me if I bought it (joking of course). He told me that Olympus compacts cameras always have issues. So i completely ignored him and bought it anyway. The package arrives, I remove it from the box, and plug in the camera charger...Hmmm, there is no power going to the camera. Note this camera does not have a removable battery that you charge, you must plug the USB cord into the AC charger. My genius BF tells me I can use any USB AC charger. I plug it into my iPhone AC charger and it works, we have juice flowing to the camera. Okay, so fresh out of the box I have a non-working AC charger. I can live with that. Next I turn it on and take some photos of the room just to check the quality of normal lighting pictures. Three huge dust balls INSIDE the lens!!! Every picture in macro mode has three gray blobs. This cannot be fixed by me. But I can always send it in for service. next I test this little baby on a trip to Latin America where I am going to swim in a waterfall. I know my way around a camera, probably better than the average amateur. What a piece of crap this thing is, aside from the non-working charger and lovely gray dust blobs. What inconsistency in the shots. Two shots from the same angle at the same location and you have totally different results. I took approximately 100 shots with this camera in fresh water and salt water. I was extremely disappointed and was wondering what reviewers were smoking when they rated this thing so highly. I ended up with perhaps 25 salvageable images. Do yourself a favor and buy a disposable underwater camera at the grocery store; you will get about the same quality photos for a much more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: John briggs
Reviews.Content: I was issued an older version of this camera for work and liked it so much I purchased one for a trip to the Caribbean. It takes amazing pictures, is waterproof to a depth of 50 feet and has great digital filters. This point and shoot works better than my DSLR!I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: So many great (not so talked about) features!
Reviews.Author: Dianna "Dianna"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a Christmas gift from my husband, I've only had  it for a few days, and I don't like writing reviews this early in the game, but there are so many positives so far, I just had to because there are things I'm finding with this camera that I hadn't seen reviewed yet. So here it goes!!!I've only had it 4 days because the first one out of the box on Christmas day was defective. We discussed getting a different model, but this one has so many good reviews (on many different outlets) we decided to try again, I'm so glad we did! I'm not going to go into the toughness or compact features, they have been talked about at great length in other reviews.First, if you have owned an Olympus digital before, you know how complicated the menu options can be. We had a 3030zoom for about 16 years and it finally died, it took AMAZING pictures even at only 3.3 megapixals because of the lens quality, but the menu options were almost impossible to figure out. We knew  the quality of pictures was probably a no brainer with the TG-2, again, because of Olympus lens quality and I was willing to take on the menu again.To my surprise the menu, though still pretty involved, has a VERY cool feature!! It has a cheater window at the bottom of each option to tell you EXACTLY what that feature does. (you can turn that off if you want, but who would want to? :-})  With the 3030 I always had to refer back to the owners manual which was also daunting. But with the TG-2 I only have to look at the manual occasionally because of the newness yet. So if you are worried about the reputation Olympus has with the menus fear not, they have listened to the consumer about this one!Another really cool feature is that you can make "folders" for grouping pictures which is very cool if you are going to be on trips at various locations, you won't have to try and organize once you download to the computer, a lot of the work will already be done for you.The pictures I have taken so far are AMAZINGLY clear and detailed (even in some not so good lighting) and the colors just pop! It has even out done my Cannon EOS Rebel at only 2 more megapixels. I love all of the special effects features, I'm having a lot of fun playing around with them. (it's in the "magic" menu) I also took a video of my cats playing, very clear and defined. I like that you can just hit the red button to start recording, no more switching modes to do so.The one and only drawback I have found is that if you zoom during video recording you can hear the motor very clearly in the video itself. So make sure you are zoomed in and out before you start recording. Or a person could possibly cover it with music? Not sure about that yet.If you are on the fence about this one, I highly recommend giving it a try. If I find other things about it, I will update my review as needed.

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera
Reviews.Author: MG
Reviews.Content: I have owned several point and shoot cameras, and this by far is my favorite.  I have backpacked for several long stents and have always been loyal to Cannon, however when the time can to get a new camera, though difficult I made the brand switch to the Tough Olympus and have never been sorry.I have had this camera, snorkeling, at the beach, in the snow, in the pool, dropped on rocks, in the desert, with me riding dirt bikes, at a baseball game and everywhere else I have been, and my favorite part is, it performs amazing every time.  The quality of pictures is amazing.  There are fun different enhancement you can choose right on the camera to make your picture take on a different appearance, similar to some of the apps available for our camera phones.The camera is easy to clean, and so far after many events in the water I have had no difficulty with any leaks.  All the moveable compartments, for battery and memory card, ect have 2 locks to make sure securely fastened to prevent such leaks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for your money
Reviews.Author: SexySmartGal
Reviews.Content: This camera does what many years ago one needed fancy Nikon's for.  Now, I do not use current fancy Nikon's and other premium photographer's dream cameras - yet.  I speak from my photo and enlargement quality.  I am well aware of the advances and choice of premium cameras for professional underwater and above water cameras from the likes of professionals like Cathy Church.  And the need for great lighting.  Checking and greasing o rings each dive.  Patience.  Water clarity.  Being very still.  And I am certain that those wanting the most supreme camera on the market will step things up a level...  But for those that just want a really great camera for snorkeling or SCUBA to 50' without a housing or several hundred with a housing, this camera is excellent.  I like it on the underwater mount with a very bright light.  And with a filter as everyone knows the further you go down... The less light and color will show up and particularily red disappears the fastest.  To have better photos adequate lighting and filter for red is imperative.  Else, just take photos in 10-15 ft.  If you want great photos.  This camera takes great photos under and above water just as it is.  But more professional photos with lighting and filter.  Video above water and sound quality is very good.  As is video below water, but sounds there should be dubbed over with music.  Who wants to hear bubbles?Makes a really great gift!Just bought another for a family member as I loved it so much!Only trouble so far is the screws hold corrosive salt, so I need to keep an eye on them, and maybe bring a toothbrush on dives for better rinse-ability.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof!
Reviews.Author: dantoncito
Reviews.Content: Camera takes good pictures but it leaks water to inside the camera so lens gets foggy. Battery life is good.  Underwater pics are fair. Camera is overprice.

Reviews.Title: Needed Something for the Great Outdoors
Reviews.Author: Skip
Reviews.Content: We love camping, hiking, skiing, boating, etc. Pretty much anything that gets us outside in all types of weather is what I needed a camera for. I already had a camera that takes really nice photos, but it isn't waterproof, drop resistant or dirt resistant. I wanted to be able to capture memories of the things we love doing, not just events that everyone brings cameras to like weddings and holiday parties. So, I researched rugged cameras and narrowed my choices all the way down to this one. And after owning it for several months now, I can honestly say I don't think I'll ever again take out my other camera.This camera has been submerged in water, dropped accidentally, in below freezing temperatures, at the beach, in the rain, in the woods... it hasn't missed an opportunity to capture those amazing memories. And the photos are great quality - just as good if not better than my other camera that I babied.It's a great little camera that can and does go everywhere with me.I would recommend getting the Joby GorillaPod Hybrid Red (in any available color) tripod with this camera, so you can be in the photo too every now and then.I also have the Lowepro Rezo 30 -Black case. The TG-2 fits very snug in the case, but it does fit. I went with the 30 because I wanted the smallest case I could find that would fit the camera. This case was the one I liked best.

Reviews.Title: Drop it, toss it, waterboard it, it's TOUGH!
Reviews.Author: Lauri Mannikko
Reviews.Content: This one tough camera I have dropped on pavement, in a lake [but with float collar attached] that has captured images far better than my iPhone, and about the same weight. I used to depend upon my phone but that likely would not survive similar abuse. Downloading pictures to my laptop was simple with the supplied cable but the video needed the Quick Time player to view them, which was available for free online. Great camera! Be careful with the GPS, it uses more power than I expected so its best to have an extra battery. Make sure to turn off the GPS if not in use.

Reviews.Title: A great vacation camera
Reviews.Author: FrenchKheldar
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this purchase, camera performed very well during our trip to Belize. f/2.0 aperture helps a lot underwater, if you can get close to the subject and shoot wide open, the results are really nice. Main areas to improve: RAW support, camera responsiveness to take first shot (it's OK, but compared to a DLSR, it's so slow. Even my iPhone 5s feels faster). The zoom is indeed clearly audible during videos, especially underwater, but since I'm putting music over the images, it's not a big deal to me... Also, selection of the video mode, especially slow-mo, is not very intuitive...

Reviews.Title: BEST OUT DOOR JUNKIES BUY!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: JESSE OGDEN
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my gf and I. We are always doing beach, hiking, motorcycle, and photo shoots. Takes amazing pictures all around. under waters are great. low light is great! the quick shutter speed is great. all around a great buy if you are an outdoor enthusiast but still want good photos! We did manage to break it by dropping it on kitchen floor from hand height and it broke off little plastic corner.....we were pretty bummed, but am pretty sure it was just a lemon or defect on that 1st one. amazon was more than awesome and just sent a brand new one right away! amazing service! new camera has been amazing and no new problems :). I went all out and bought the extra zoom lens and fish eye and silicone case and float strap! no regrets only amazing pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great versitile camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy using this camera!  I have 5 kids ages 14 to 3 and they all love using it as well.  It is easy enough to use and you get great pictures.  It is tough enough that I can let the kids use it and not worry about it being broken. I take this camera hiking with me and use the video and pictures to make presentations.  People can't believe the images come from a point and shoot camera!  I also use the f2.0 for low light pictures of the kids sporting events with great results.  The one negative I have is that once you switch to a setting with an automatic lower file size to one that you can choose it automatically keeps the lower file setting despite you previously setting the file size, but that is a minor inconvienence. The display screen is not apart of the tough package and is easily scratched.  I kept the camera in pocket in my cargo pants one day with noted micro scratches from rubbing.  I suggest buying a screen protector.

Reviews.Title: I give it 3.7
Reviews.Author: micah brady
Reviews.Content: I have the older Olympus Tough and love that it is waterproof, drop proof, and mud proof. I upgraded to this one as it was hard to take action shots with the old one due to the shutter speed. This by comparison is far, far better. It turns on/off quickly, and you can shoot several in a row because of the better shutter speed. I do wish this came with a lens cap for the price, and also that the zoom was wider, but I guess you make some sacrificies.I bring these tough cameras on boating trips, mud runs, and allow the nieces and nephews to use it since it's so durable.

Reviews.Title: SO, these reviews are mixed, but I love mine
Reviews.Author: Peyton Watson
Reviews.Content: The underwater shots were fantastic for the money, the only real competitor in its category is the NIkon equivalent and this still beats it in terms of photo quality, appearance and overall performance.Took mine to North Western Australia and it made my trip 10x more memorable. Unbelievable shots. great above and below water. The macro function will blow your mind. I could take pics of individual polyps of coral. loved it.the "bad"-underwater audio amplified the zoom feature, but i mean shit - what audio am i missing out on thats underwater? none. You'll end up putting music to your videos anyway so this makes absolutely 0 difference in purchasing.-Ive been using it for a month and seriously cant think of another reason-get this camera

Reviews.Title: One of the best cameras but in humid conditions it gets fogged up
Reviews.Author: Nicole Warne-McGraw
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best cameras we have ever owned, we took almost 1500 shots on a recent trip to Hawaii.  However, in very humid conditions the area inside the lens would fog up and leave water spots on the pictures.  We did not think a waterproof camera would allow any condensation inside the mechanism itself.Would have given this Camera a five-star rating except for this one flaw.Perhaps it is a problem that is unique to this camera and we need to return it for a new one.

Reviews.Title: Great...but
Reviews.Author: XKR
Reviews.Content: I took this camera white water rafting and it functioned flawlessly. The only problem I encountered was the removable red ring, which comes off to facilitate additional lens mounts, would not stay on securely, and I lost both the red and black ones which came with the camera.  This is a small point, but at this price it should never have happened.  Bad design and possibly inferior manufacture is what I think of when small items go awry on these type of cameras.

Reviews.Title: Left my D90 home . . . . .
Reviews.Author: SAINT2 "saint2"
Reviews.Content: I left my Nikon D90 home on vacation this year and wasn't disappointed.The TG-2 Camera takes very nice pictures, even got some videos of Dolphins jumping in the surf.Are the pictures as nice as the D90? no.But here's the best part: not dealing with the hassle of wrapping the much bigger camera in  plastic bag, lugging it to the surf, sneaking it out to get a few shots and putting it back in the bag. Then keeping an eye on it to make sure it isn't in the surf.The TG2?I hung it right on the beach chair. Leaving me only having to worry about raising my cigar when a big wave came in.TIPS: - Olympus Tripod nice for taking team shots with timer - floating strap saved the camera when my daughter dropped in ocean - The zoom lens is odd but works - requires a menu setting change to use, so a pain but increases utility of camera - BATTERIES! very important - three days into vacation camera freaked out, thought it was water inside, turned out to be the el cheapo non OEM battery. When I put the Olympus battery back in no issue. I'd be leery about non-Olympus batteries and given the battery life with everything running (GPS altimeter etc.) is better than a day, not sure you'd need a second battery. - GASKETS! - the gasketing is decent (reference: I'm a mechanical engineer) - multiple ridges are effective at keeping water out IF YOU CHECK THE AREA FOR FOREIGN MATERIAL EVERY TIME YOU OPEN AND CLOSE. Even a hair caught in there would be enough to wick water in under the right circumstance.So for the over 40 crowd, get out your reading glasses and make sure there isn't any sand hair or anything else on the gasket or surface it seals against.BOTTOM LINE: Good at what it does and widely acclaimed as one of if not the best "waterproof" camera out there.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof, Grainy photo shooter
Reviews.Author: Techie Guy "Techie Guy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for around $380 a few months ago. I chose this one over other weatherproof cameras selling at almost 1/2 the price because of its larger aperture lens. For underwater photography, larger lens means more light means higher clarity photos.Alas, it only lasted for 1 underwater shooting. On my 2nd trip, after using it underwater for just 1 day, the camera went crazy. It still turns on, it occasionally even takes photos. But none of the menus or zoom work. Strangely, if I pop the SD card in or out, the menus suddenly become usable, but only ONCE. As soon as I select something, they vanish again.I am very anal about how I use my things and have always ensured that the double-locking was engaged for the battery/card as well as the USB compartments. But how do I PROVE it? Olympus always starts with, "We're sure YOU must have done something wrong".So now I'm stuck with a $380 paperweight that occasionally shoots pics. BTW, even when this camera was working well, it only took clear pics in bright light. In lower light conditions, the pics are very grainy, presumably because of the image sensor itself, since the lenses are of good quality.I don't know if other underwater cameras are any better. But I definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND this camera to anybody :-(

Reviews.Title: GREAT GREAT GREAT IS ALL I CAN SAY !!!!!
Reviews.Author: E. Shaffer "Eric S."
Reviews.Content: Anyone looking to get a compact digital waterproof, drop proof camera........THIS IS THE ONE. I have had it a little over a month and I can't believe how reliable this little camera is. We left the waterpark yesterday and the camera done as advertised. I wanted to put it through the ringer with the water and that's what I done. I was tossing this thing down 300 ft water slides ahead of me, taking pictures under water, dropping it, throwing it across the pool, you name it. It takes a beating and never faultered in any way. I would suggest getting the 32mb extreme card to go along with it as it does make the camera faster shooting. The floating wrist band was also a huge plus so when dropped, you did'nt have to dive for the camera. I have read some reviews of water messing it up, but all you have to do is make sure the seals are clean of dirt and lint and you're good to go. Get one and have fun !!!!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: James P kelly
Reviews.Content: - easy to use menu- fun to add the FCON filter- the option to add a UV or polarizing filter is nice

Reviews.Title: Non-standard USB cable --- grrrr
Reviews.Author: Ken J. Harris "supergeek"
Reviews.Content: I received mine today.  It looks like a great camera, however I was very disappointed to see that they use non-standard connectors on the camera, so it requires a non-standard USB cable.  If you loose that cable, and the battery runs down, then the camera is worthless.  I would not have bought if I'd known that.

Reviews.Title: You will use and love this little camera
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: =============Updated Jan 5, 2014=============Original comments stand - very happy with this cameraFlash pictures with dark background are particularly well exposed - fill flash also greatcontrol dial for changing modes is hard to change - impossible with gloves onScreen is very hard to see underwater with googles on - almost useless at times, I resort to aim/frame by guessing and shoot a lot=============End Update=============I've only had this for a few days and will update the review in a few weeks with more detail.My first impression is that this is a great little carry-everywhere camera.You get this one for toughness first of all, and that it is. see the specs - but you will be able to take this in the pool, in the ocean, oncamping trips , skiing etc, with no worries.The image quality is good at resolutions most people use.If you view/exchange pictures in emails or on the web, you will be fine. If you want to make mural size photos, this is not for you.The image colors and saturation are great - right off the camera most pictures are well exposed.handling is wonderful, especially with the small finger grip on the front of the camera.GPS is easy to use and accurate. magic mode filters are fun to play with but might get old - I would have added a black and white filter. Nothing more fun that setting the magic mode to fisheye and talking a selfie from the sink full of water looking up!The aperture priority mode will not be used by most people. it's partially only useful - with 3 preset aperture settings, not all values.setting is thru the back controls and menus, not via a dedicated dial (understandable for this price range)It would be nice to have a RAW output mode, and to be able to apply filters after the image is taken,depth of field is pretty large, given that the lens is 4.5 - 18 mm (25-100mm in standard 35mm equivalent)some have mentioned that the controls are hard to use with gloves on - that is correct. I don't see this as a big impediment,also, some have mentioned that the LCD (OLED) screen is hard to see in bright light - I can't verify this yet as I've had no problemsIn short, the best camera is the one you will carry with you and use, and this is a good and capable package that is easy to carry and you won't worry about water, dirt, snow etc.

Reviews.Title: I Recommend the TG-2 with Reservations
Reviews.Author: LAS2002
Reviews.Content: I've had the Olympus TG-2 for going on 4 months. I bought it after my Panasonic DMC-ZS3 died from some water splashes from the Flow Rider on a cruise ship. I decided to go with the TG-2 because of the durability, F2.0 lens, and advertised great picture quality. Here's what I've found:(1) A lot of photos lack sharpness - almost like the auto-focus isn't really locking on the subject. I've also tried spot focus and metering without any great improvement. (2) The camera performs poorly with a backlit subject.  I think its because Olympus relies too much on the F2.0 lens in its automatic settings. That's to say, it selects an open lens (close to F2.0) but in iAUTO mode, the flash hardly ever fires, even in low light. This is especially noticeable with back lighting (why doesn't the flash fire???). I have also tried manual settings in P mode - with forced flash and manual back lighted compensation - but, I usually get an almost properly exposed subject with a really washed-out background. On other cameras, I've been able to find settings that pretty consistently work with back light. (3) Overall picture quality out doors in sun is good to very good. However, If your taking a photo of a person with their face as the subject, their face still lacks sharp focus.Bottom Line: So, I would still buy the TG-2, however, with reservations. I would buy it again because I don't want to be on a trip and have my camera konk-out because of a small water splash - like my Panasonic did. But, don't expect the excellent overall results that you would get from a high end non-tough point shoot.My biggest question is - Why doesn't Olympus allow the flash to fire in iAUTO (or more correctly, it ALMOST never flashes in that mode - and rather opens the lens toward F2.0 giving poor depth of field and less than optimum lighting compensation.

Reviews.Title: Camera met all expectations
Reviews.Author: Zachery McCarty
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a snorkeling and diving vacation and it worked perfectly.  The auto focus had some trouble with a few shots of fish, but that may have been due to operator error (trying to swim and take pictures at the same time) as much  as it could have been an inadequacy of the camera.  As others have noted, the picture snaps as soon as you press the shutter button, no lag.  This was nice, and some of the pictures of fish, rays, coral, etc. came out very well even in deeper water.The deepest I took the camera was about 10m.  No problems with water proofing as some have claimed with Nikon and Cannon underwater cameras.  The opening compartments are double locked which makes me feel as though they are well protected.This camera feels very sturdy and well put together.  It is a little heavy and bulky, but for what I bought it for, it's perfect.  I still use a DSLR as my main travel camera, and I'm sure there are much better point and shoot cameras that would get better picture quality and are lighter and smaller than the TG-2, but if you are looking for a rugged point and shoot with good underwater capability I would highly recommend this.  I'm looking forward to taking this on my next camping/kayaking trip later this spring.One other note, a lot of people complain about the noise in the video function.  I shot a few short videos underwater, and there is a little bit of noise, but I bought this camera for photos not videos, and the noise in the videos did not really bother me.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater pictures
Reviews.Author: H. v. Keller
Reviews.Content: I've been testing the camera since a week and got good results. Normally using an SLR and another second high quality compact (Sony DSC RX-100), this is basically my third camera for beach days. My main idea was to have a camera which is good enough to leave the others at home without feeling sorry every time. Great feeling to throw it in the sand on the beach without having to worry and simply wash the dirt off at home. Underwater, it also worked very well, sharp and crisp colors and easy to operate. The manual controls are good enough as well for this purpose. I have not tried any accessories yet and don't think I need anything else than the camera itself.

Reviews.Title: Rugged Fail
Reviews.Author: TimRobinsin
Reviews.Content: I have been shooting with a Nikon AW100 for the last 2 years. Recently the AW100 was damaged and went in for repair. In the meantime I wanted to try something else. I picked up the TG-2 in time for a fishing trip to michigan. Right out of the gate I noticed the pictures were not as sharp and while the camera shoots faster than the Nikon the images were useless.I was further disappointed with the TG-2 when it fell out of my waders while I was taking them off. The camera fell only 2 feet to the ground but the force was enough to crack the video display. Needless to say I was unable to use the camera underwater after that.Very disappointed with this camera and I have since returned it.I look forward to getting my nikon back and trying some other cameras too.

Reviews.Title: wrong charger plug, camera dead
Reviews.Author: Longshadow
Reviews.Content: The "Tough" little Olympus TG-2 iHS is pretty to look at, but it sits dead in front of me. Amazon's Pavillion Electronics sent a charger cable with a European style 3-pronged plug, instead of a standard 2-pronged plug. I live in Oregon, so someone at Pavillion goofed. You'd think that Amazon Customer Service would have quickly and easily ordered the right cable and have it shipped to me overnight (I need the camera as I type this). Instead, I was on the phone with an Amazon rep for about an hour. Most of the time I was kept on-hold. Finally, the rep said he would call me back. He didn't. Instead he sent a terse email, which said only this: "Thank you for contacting us." So on my own, I had to find a different Amazon Customer Service rep. Fortunately, I found a competent and very pleasant agent, who set up an order for a 2-pronged plug, but from a different supplier. It's now in the middle of the next day, and the part hasn't been shipped yet. I just found out that it won't be shipped by the fastest carrier for overnight delivery in the morning. I paid for the $18 replacement part, and then got an email saying it would be refunded on credit card. But the email said it was for a replacement 32 GB memory card, which I ordered with the camera. The memory card appears to be fine. I tried to email a reply to Amazon about the mistake, but my email was blocked.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Dianne Hall
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after doing extensive research because I wanted something waterproof for a two-week vacation to Hawaii. I took it snorkeling with me many times and it performed flawlessly. No leaks. The photo quality was excellent , the colors were vibrant and bright and pictures overall were just fantastic! This is my new favorite camera!

Reviews.Title: Major unacceptable flaw
Reviews.Author: AB
Reviews.Content: As others have commented there is a very annoying noise when recording video.  I knew this when buying the camera thinking that it couldn't possibly be that bad.  Well, I was wrong.  The noise is horrible and overpowers anything you are video recording.  It is so bad I honestly don't know why Olympus would ship this half baked product, especially considering that it sounds like the previous years model had the same issue.  I honestly don't think that this should have been released to the market with this flaw and I am dumbfounded that after a year the problem still exists.  If you plan on using this camera to record video at all do yourself a favor and buy a different camera.  We got this mainly for still but the video audio quality is so poor that we returned it.

Reviews.Title: From a professional photographer: Avoid this camera
Reviews.Author: Brendan Bullock "bullockphoto"
Reviews.Content: I make my living as a photographer and use the highest-end gear on a daily basis.  I have wanted a waterproof camera for years, and so I decided to start reading reviews online...  Many of them pointed to the Tough TG-2 as a 'best-in-class' point and shoot.  I have never liked Olympus' products, so I was a bit leery, but after such across-the-board high marks, I decided to give it a shot.Upon my first time out with the camera, I immediately noticed a couple issues - the first was ergonomic, the other was image quality.Ergonomics - command dial very stiff to turn, especially with wet hands.  The arrow pad is located too close to the command dial and ends up requiring you to almost click with your fingernail instead of fingertip to make selections...  Just kind of put me off.The #1 reason to avoid this camera is POOR IMAGE QUALITY.  With technology being what it is today, you should NOT look at a full sized image, shot at the lowest ISO (100) and see pixelation.  These files are super pixel-y, even at ISO100.  Now granted, I am used to using very nice cameras, but nevertheless, IF YOU CARE ABOUT IMAGE QUALITY and printing, avoid this camera. Trust me.If all you want to do are post snapshots to Facebook, etc, I'm sure this will do the trick, but if you love photography and good images, find another model.Lastly, I had it yesterday in the ocean, third time I have used it.  I started getting fogging inside with everything sealed up properly...  Didn't notice till after I had made many blurry, out-of-focus pictures.  Really disappointed.  Going to try and return to Amazon - hope I can still get my money back and put it towards something better.  I should have known better than to go with Olympus after seeing the poor quality of their pro gear in the past!  Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: Not the best, but ok
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. Kuhnhenn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for an extended hiking trip.  Not wanting to carry my Nikon DSLR, I wanted a camera that I could strap on my pack and not worry about bouncing and rain.  While it has some fun features like the special effects, I find the overall picture quality has much to be desired.  The zoom produces grainy pictures.  The ring around the lens fell off almost immediately and is now somewhere in the wilds of Montana.  I would use this camera as a novelty because the special effects and the underwater capability are fun but the picture quality is not what I would expect from a camera in this price range.  My Nikon Coolpix does a much better job (although not durable--it met an unfortunate end in Wyoming).  My hiking buddy has the Lumix version of this camera which does much better for less money.  I will keep playing with settings and have fun with it but will be saving my pennies for the Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, tough, versatile point & shoot
Reviews.Author: R. D'Alessandro III "rudydale"
Reviews.Content: I've now owned the TG-2 Tough camera from Olympus since May 2013, a year, in which I've been able to assess many of its major and minor functions and capabilities and can truly say that I love this camera, with some small caveats.Like many, I purchased the TG-2 because of its underwater capabilities, but before I ever took it underwater I started shooting on land and was wowed by the clarity of the images in strong sunlight - no washing out of sky when focusing on land, but bright clear blues with rich earth tones together.  Contrast this with the manipulations I need to do with my DSLR and this handy little camera has become my go-to device when not looking to shoot portraits or sports, fast action images.  The one caveat I have - although I've dropped the camera a few times, and the fisheye lens I bought separately (which I love!), I've not been brave enough to take it underwater.I've also bought the telephoto lens, which seems to need to be fully extended to work properly.  One interesting combination I found that works is that I can attach the fisheye lens to the end of the telephoto lens and get some very funky images, though not particularly clear.Let me say this about the "Magic" mode on the camera - it's fantastic!  Try and you'll love it.  It allows you to do soft focus, richer hues, mirroring, mosaic and what looks close to HDR.  If you visit my Flickr page - [...] - you'll see some examples of the flexibility of imagery you get with this setting.There's also the SCENE mode, which allows you to adjust between even more optional settings - indoor, landscape, sport, selfie, snow, underwater, panorama, HDR, night, documents, etc.  I've tried the HDR setting and frankly prefer the output using the Magic mode's 11th setting, mentioned above.A drawback regarding the video function - although I find that the video is clear and the audio levels are acceptable, on my Dell PC I find that I cannot replay the videos using Windows Media Player.  There are probably other player software that will work, but this is puzzling that WMP won't play the videos.  Don't know if you'll encounter that problem working on an Apple platform.All in all, though, I think you'll find this camera is as tough as advertised, and provides far more capabilities than realized.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera until you get it wet
Reviews.Author: Van
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to the Virgin Islands. I got it a couple of months prior to my trip so I could try it out and get comfortable with it.  As a point and shoot it is a great little camera.  Pics came out great and it has many features.  Would have been a five star until I took it into the water.  On my very first snorkel it leaked and was ruined.  After drying out a couple of days it did turn on but the menu would not work, nor the picture viewer.  That was the only camera I took on the trip besides my phone, so I didn't get many pics on the trip.  VERY Disappointed.  Upon my return I called Olympus and they said it should be covered and to send it back, so the jury is still out on their customer service.  But when I do get it back I will be afraid to take it in the water which is the reason I bought this model to begin with.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, bad strap
Reviews.Author: Donald C Nordin
Reviews.Content: We have used this camera in all kinds of harsh conditions, the camera does well. The strap that comes with it is not good, it released twice, once in the ocean and we almost lost the camera and all the pictures on it. Use a different strap!!! Seriously!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera with some notable flaws
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: I wanted badly to keep this camera, but couldn't because it's flaws were too great. It took decent pictures, but awful video. 1080p on this thing looked worse than 720p on an older camera. It makes a loud readjustment sound while taking video. The lens ring will fall off all the time for no reason.

Reviews.Title: Olympus needs better quality control
Reviews.Author: dale2215
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I could find on waterproof cameras, the Olympus TG-2 seemed to be everyone's choice as the best from those currently available.  Fast lens, good picture quality and comparable or better specs then the rest.  I've only had the camera for a few days but from the test shots I've taken, the pictures are pretty good, and the camera is easy to use.  The pictures aren't as sharp and clear as the ones I get from my DSLR and best lens, but I didn't expect them to be.  They are as good or better than my other point and shoot cameras of a similar price point though.  What I do find troubling, and why I've only given a three star rating is Olympus's quality control.  My first copy of this camera was virtually dead on arrival.  It took two pictures and then died.  The camera would only turn on and off and give me the info screen, but nothing more.  Back to Amazon it went, and Amazon promptly sent me another camera without issue.Camera number 2 arrived, and this time the camera worked.  I went through the setup, numerous on and off cycles, test shots and video clips, and the camera works perfectly.  However, when I opened the CD that came with the camera that contains the camera manual, editing software, and registration info on it, there is a huge crack in the CD that makes it completely unusable. Not catastrophic, but frustrating.  Fortunately all of the software can be obtained from the Olympus web site, but this is completely unacceptable quality control for just about any product, and especially for one that costs as much as these cameras do.  To receive two different copies of the same product and for each one to have a defect in it, will definitely make me think more than twice about buying any other Olympus product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for on/in/near water use
Reviews.Author: Bill Gehring
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera to take snorkeling and kayaking on a recent trip to the Galapagos Islands; this camera filled the bill.  It did a fine job on underwater stills and movies.  Above water results were very good, but if that's all you want to shoot, there are cameras that will produce slightly better results.  Any camera with this degree of versatility will force some compromises.  The TG-2 is a relatively easy camera to learn to use.  The interface is fairly intuitive, and there are some convenient settings (three for underwater shots alone).  It also does a nice job on panoramic shots.I researched this class of cameras online (best comparative review was on dpreview.com) and decided on the TG-2.  I have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: The pictures are great.
Reviews.Author: Hole In 1
Reviews.Content: Pictures in both salt water as well as chlorine came out great. Still playing with the "other" features on the camera. But I'm still learning.

Reviews.Title: for its size and price it would be hard to beat.
Reviews.Author: PJP
Reviews.Content: Took the Olympus TG-2 to the BVI for a week of sailing and snorkeling. Camera worked great both in the water and out. Good quality pictures, easy to use and made me wish i had left the Nikon digital behind.

Reviews.Title: Great little underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Malvina Craig "reader"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a trip to Hawaii.  it was so much fun taking pictures and film under water during our snorkeling adventures.  It also took great pictures above the water.  We had no issues at all with leaking.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: Only negative was that little ring on the front.  It comes with two of them.. both fell off and got lost in a week. Not good.Other than that, seems to be everything it says it is.

Reviews.Title: Great dive camera
Reviews.Author: Wyopilot
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on 3 dives, used it on the beach and it worked perfectly.  Deepest dive was bout 46 feet which is within the limits.  I would recommend this as a great value for a dive camera.  Pictures were very good.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pics for a point & shoot
Reviews.Author: D. Chowdhary "World Traveller"
Reviews.Content: Very responsive - get immediate shots, pictures turn out awesome, underwater is amazing. Video was not bad either. Only drawback is it is a little bigger than smaller cameras, but still fits in a jean pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shot
Reviews.Author: Kate Turner
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shot camera, the best that I have every owned. It can take really good pictures on the move, we have even taken a lot of scenic pictures from a moving car.  The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is that I took it on a trip and the first day the red ring (around the shutter) fell of some where and I lost it, however it did come with a black ring but it was over a week before I was home to get it.

Reviews.Title: Rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a refurb.  The camera looked like it was brand new.  The only item that was missing was an extra ring that fits around the lens.  A new one comes with both a black and red ring.  My refurb only came with a red one.I wanted a rugged camera to take pictures during a Tough Mudder.  I carried the camera around my neck using a metal lanyard.  It survived all the various mud and water obstacles, including the Artic Enema.  The only obstacle I did not carry this camera on was the Plank.  This camera was submerged under water and dragged through mud.  It survived all of this without a scratch.  I was very happy about the ruggedness of this camera.The camera is a little heavy-- no surprise. Since I was going to be occupied with running and dealing with all the obstacles, I had the camera set to auto and hoped the camera would choose the correcting settings when I had the opportunity to take a picture.  Unfortunately, I was expecting too much.  Some of the pictures had blown highlights or were too dark.  What bothered me the most was that the LCD was pretty much useless in the sunlight.  I found myself just pointing the camera at my friends and hope I would get them in the frame.I admit that a few of the bad pictures were due to the operator, or water/mud on the lens.  However, this is not a cheap camera.  I expected better when the lens was clean and I was able to properly frame a shot.Despite these draw backs, I like this camera.  It is very rugged, and I do realize it is a point and shoot camera.  Although I was disappointed with the quality of some of the pictures, it did allow me and my friends to record memories during the race that could not have been done with other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Tough? Not the LCD screen...
Reviews.Author: Lenny Christian
Reviews.Content: Great photos BUT the first time we used it we somehow managed to get a large zig-zag scratch across the viewing LCD screen.  This is supposed to be a 'rugged' waterproof camera.  How the heck did they make the LCD screen out of material that scratched so easily.  We were very careful with our new camera which we kept in a protective case.  Bad flaw.Also, I wasn't expecting the camera to be made with a shiny finish - a bit of barracuda appeal?Otherwise - brilliant.

Reviews.Title: Leaked and replaced by Amazon
Reviews.Author: Kenneth R. Dodge "Ken "It's choice - not ...
Reviews.Content: this camera would have receiveda 5 star rating except that the first one i received leaked in 5' of water. We were on vacation in Fiji and were very satisfied with the pictures up until that disaster.. While SCUBA divers, we only used this camera for snorkling as we had other cameras for our deep dives. The pictures above and below the surface were great until 2 days before we left when the camera leaked. We never opened the battery case and charged only through the port and I was always careful to make sure the edges were clean and sealed. As the next part of or vacation was in Hawaii I contacted Amazon and they shipped another one that was waiting for us at our hotel. AS USUAL, FANTASTIC CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM AMAZON!!!!. Used once for snorkling in Hawaii and it worked well. Pictures were fantastic for scenery and people so we are happy right now.

Reviews.Title: Make sure you get it locked
Reviews.Author: Sue Canaday
Reviews.Content: the camera takes excellent photos in and out of the water.  The camera is easy to use.  However my camera is destroyed.  I thought that I had both locks locked but they were not, I got salt water in the camera and it is now a goner.  The one complaint that I have is the locking of the SD card and the battery.  There are two locks on each and it is very hard to tell if the are all locked or not.  I would buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera but no lens protection
Reviews.Author: Omar
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!  Among other things, it has a super macro mode with which you can capture things really close.  I like almost everything about this camera so far.  I tested it underwater and it has worked great so far.  Regarding picture quality and other aspects of it, it is great, including video.  At first I didn't hear any noise at all in the video as described by other customers.  After some time I did started to hear the annoying noise.  You can mitigate it a little by lowering the microphone volume.  I also noted that the microphones are located on the top left corner of the camera which is where someone usually puts the fingers when holding the camera.  You need to be careful not to block the microphone when holding the camera.  Some things I don't like about the camera are the following: No lens protection!  This is suppossed to be a tough camera but I am really worried that the lens will get scratched or damaged in some way if hit by something.  If this happens then the camera is useless for me, no matter how tough it is.  I mean, it would have been great if it had some kind of lens protection, at least when turned off.  So I don't feel very confident about this camera being so tough because of this, same with the LCD, although it says the LCD is scratch resistant. Also I consider the camera is a little heavy for its size, and bigger than what I expected, but it is not too big either.  It has a special USB connector for the camera, so you cannot use other cable.  The video noise is a negative also.  The price seemed a little high to me, but I guess it is a high quality camera.  Overall it is a great camera and I like it.  Hope it lasts.

Reviews.Title: Awesome point and shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: aussie_girl62
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband to use on a recent trip to the US. He was booked to do a shark dive and I wanted someone to be able to take pics underwater. I own a Canon DSLR so appreciated that a small point and shoot was  not going to produce the type of image I am used to. When I first saw one of the pics taken while he was out on a fishing boat I said to my son " I really hope that picture was taken with the new camera as the colour capture is amazing." It was and so therefore I was very happy. The one single feature that caused me to buy this camera was the high aperture setting ( for me to get a DSLR lens with a setting like this I would have to spend close to $1000) and the Aperture priority mode. I have some great shots of hubby with the sharks as well as a some great low light pics. Some of the reviews have been really harsh but I think people need to understand this is a small, point and shoot camera not a DSLR. It is packed with features and without reading the manual I was able to work out how to use it. Hubby did not have any problems with it not being watertight and it is now back home with me as dry as they day it was delivered. I ordered it from Amazon and had it delivered to an address in the US when it was on sale. It was around $200 cheaper than I would have been able to get it in Australia if I had been able to find a site or store which sold it! So overall I am very happy. If people are having problems with the quality of their images it may have more to do with the settings than with the camera. Do some reading and find out how to take great shots! I haven't experienced any problems with the buttons being too close together although as a woman my hands are obviously smaller than a man. Bright light, low light the pics have all come out really well.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Sebastien R. Derenoncourt
Reviews.Content: beautiful quality images in and out of water.definitely worth every penny.The only real limitations is manual controls and no raw format support.But this is not meant to be a professional camera replacement, it is meant to be an entry into underwater cameras.We where down in baja california, snorkeling and fishing, and it was awesome.As long as you are careful with all the locks being set properly, avoiding getting sand and obstructions getting in the seals it works great.The camera tells you when the latches and doors are not set correctly or if there is an issue with the seals.it was also great fun to use making surreal pool portraits and other optical tricks with water.GPS is fairly accurate although very very slow.Altimeter, was ok, it work fine going down, but testing it in plane it could figure out anything past 5899 feet.compass was fun, and also worked, in fact a couple times during our bag packing trip, I used these functions to figure out where we where on map, because our gps died. (garmin sucks).for some reason it comes with the ability to swap out the face ring, which is actually more annoying then anything with a product you want to be very secure feeling.I hope the next version gets even better!

Reviews.Title: It broke once
Reviews.Author: Dr. Peggy Scott "Peggy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera the first time and it broke. It just stopped working, I wasn't even rough with it, I used it in a couple of wet settings, but something made it fail. So I contacted Amazon, and their fantastic customer support, and they sent me another one. I like the camera, but I am so nervous about using it in a water situation, or dropping it, or even doing what it is advertised to do. It has fun settings on it and it is small enough to capture some good stuff, but if it is going to be your primary camera, I am not sure it is the best quality. There are A LOT of complaints about the videos and the sound...it is not bad, but if the wind is blowing it is horrible. It really depends on the setting you are taking the video. So again, I like it, I liked it enough to have amazon send me another camera instead of the $$ for the broken one. But I also have a really big cannon that I use, so this camera is not always my primary.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, OK video.
Reviews.Author: RCCTech "RCCTech"
Reviews.Content: The camera is durable and takes great photos. You can beat it and of course get it wet. It's great for travel and outdoor adventures. The video works fine but the noise from the zoom is loud on replay of the recording.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Babbitt
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera, perfect for our trip to Costa Rica- we could take it everywhere. The only weird thing about it is that there is nothing that covers the lens to protect from scratches... But it has yet to get scratched so thats good!

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: J.warren
Reviews.Content: I just started to delve into the many operational functions of this camera, however, I LOVE it so far! The only reason I did not give it a 5 star rating was the little tabs on the usb and battery doors are fairly fragile and I broke one off after its first drop... But it has had no effect on the waterproofness of the housing at all, even after SEVERAL underwater photo shoots and an 8 day sea kayak expedition.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: stephanie hawkins
Reviews.Content: LOVE this camera! Takes amazing photos. Big learning curve cause so many features, but one I played around with it a bunch I got the hang of panorama, macro, super macro, etc. My only complaint is that even though it's supposed to be waterproof, it stopped working after splashing in a couple of ocean waves on the beach. We followed the directions to clean off, but still froze up. Sent back and got a replacement right away. Haven't taken this in water yet, so we'll see!

Reviews.Title: olympus tg2
Reviews.Author: T "T"
Reviews.Content: It's everything I had hoped for.  Super photos, easy to use, battery lasts 2 days in constant use. lens ring falls off alot

Reviews.Title: second TG
Reviews.Author: William G Garnett
Reviews.Content: I am a field botanist working in rugged, wet conditions in Hawaii and loved my Olympus TG-1 (especially the macro and HD video, except the lense zoom noise in video mode everyone comments on) which was stolen from a rental car, for the 9 months I owned it the TG-2 seem to be just as good

Reviews.Title: Goes Everywhere, Great fun
Reviews.Author: Chris I
Reviews.Content: Very good image quality in a tough and well designed package. The super close up feature is excellent, the build in LCD illumination is genius. While the flash is a tad wimpy, the camera does take very good flash photos in near darkness if your subject is within range. I've experienced no excessive pixelation as one reviewer noted. Small sensor noise and smearing from noise reduction degrade the image to some extent but overall the images look quite good. The video quality is good but audio suffers from some noise during optical zooming. If you are looking for a fun camera that you can take anywhere without concern for environmental conditions, this could be for you. If you're fussy about minute detail and want the highest image quality in a portable p+s camera, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Good sports camera overall, poor video quality.
Reviews.Author: juancho
Reviews.Content: This camera has plenty of nice features. Picture quality is good. It has a "low light in movement" mode that is awesome.Video has lot of noisy. Olympus should take care of that.

Reviews.Title: ..a very Tough TG-2
Reviews.Author: mdmiataman
Reviews.Content: ...this Olympus Tough TG-2 camera was a recent purchase on Amazon and this review is from a legitimate Amazon customer. Let me begin by saying that I'm not a professional photographer, but an enthusiast. I have many cameras that were purchased here on Amazon over the last couple of years. (Nikon D5100 and several lenses; Canon G12; Lumix LX-7; Olympus Tough TG-2. These cameras were purchased after many diligent hours of research based on reviews and comparisons found on the internet, as well as the few times I could actually see and feel the cameras in brick and mortor stores around Baltimore, Washington DC and Annapolis.  ... let me say from the start and say that the TG-2 is a great little camera, and thus far, I have only used it for 2 days in my local pool. I have made several videos and took about 25 snaps. The camera has proved itself so far, though I have reservations about the video portions of the camera that were wavy and had some issues on playback on the camera and on my laptop. I will update this review in the next few months.
