My main decision for choosing this camera over the competition was the many years Olympus has in making it's waterproof/ weather-resistant cameras and the various first-person reviews I had read. Granted, it's not as guaranteed waterproof as my deep-diving or snorkeling camera combination, (Canon Elph 310HS $200 / Ikelite 6243.31 Underwater Camera Housing $250) but for a small camera with decent features it will serve me well.  Feel free to send me your questions through Amazon.  ** UPDATE - Sept 2nd 2013 **  ..this has proved to be an excellent little camera in and out of bad weather. I have used it primarily at the pool this summer taking some excellent shots of my grand daughter and her friends. For land use the camera takes excellent snaps and is now my carry-everywhere camera. If you are inventative enough and like to play as I do you will enjoy the ART scenes portion, that take some very different snaps.  ... and just to make sure I could keep the lens from getting scratched I recently purchased the Rainbowimaging 40.5mm Conversion Lens Adapter, a Fotodiox 40.5mm Snap-on Lens Cap and the Vivitar Series 3-Piece Multi-Coated HD Pro Filter Set. (this set has a UV filter, a CPL circular polarizing filter and a ND 8 neutral density filter.  Total cost was about $27.00. This set-up now gives me the security of keeping the UV filter on the camera when I'm not shooting underwater and then I can add the CPL or the ND8 on front of the UV filter when shooting pictures at the beach. (Just remember to remove all of the filters before shooting underwater, as I don't think they are water-sealed and water may enter the threaded area and get trapped between them and the camera lens.)  ..so far the only issue I have had with the TG-2 is the lens adapter cover rings that are suppilied with the camera. They do come off very easily. Many people have mentioned losing them on shootings. (I had one come off the camera myself oneday. Now Olympus gives you a black and a red as spares, so keep an eye out when using them on this camera, as they are not on very tight. (I will mention that the RainbowImaging conversion adapter is a VERY snug connection and this will not fall off as easily)

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Durable
Reviews.Author: Mr. E.
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is an excellent point and shoot camera. It lost one star only because the noise during video. Like many have  talked about and even demonstrated, it is annoying and very prominent.  That being said... I really like this camera. I can not say enough about how tough it is and how tough it FEELS. And to bring it underwater, how it feels matters. It is about confidence to use the camera for what it is meant for. The pictures are sharp and crisp. I LOVE the macro mode. I have been playing with that more than any other function. It is pretty sick! Just make sure you turn the LED on when using it. I haven't found a way to keep the light on though. Every time you switch out of macro and go back, you have to turn the LED back on. I wish it was pre-set. Maybe there is a way, but I haven't found it. But no big deal, it takes half a second to turn on. The preset modes(if you get too lazy to put in A-mode or don't know how) are pretty good. Most of them do what are meant for and take good shots for being a pre-set.The only issue I had(this is my experience) with my purchase,  I had to send my first camera back. I am PRIME, and the new one came in two days at no cost, but it was still a tiny snag. I was taking a few pictures and I noticed a spot in the photos. I am familiar with what it was, sensor dust. On a DSLR it is an easy fix, but this being all contained, no go. So I sent it back and got a new one that works perfect. Just wanted to put it out there in case anyone else sees that problem.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures wherever
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: Under the sea, in the pool, during the rain, every situation is suitable for this camera. I have tested in those scenarios and works superb!Easy to use and great balance/colors/functions and features. It it the best companion for family trips.

Reviews.Title: Nice point and click!
Reviews.Author: Tara Leigh Ross
Reviews.Content: Great little (ok not so small) camera. The f2 lens and processor make it easy to get a good quality image. Macro function works well and it has remained water tight. Various functions allow you to capture more then other point and click cameras. Downfall...the plastic lens ring and 4x optical zoom. But, I would buy it again to serve as a nice point and click.

Reviews.Title: Great toy fo rthe ocean.
Reviews.Author: Rocio Lopez
Reviews.Content: Love it, love it!  Love the GPS on it.  Love the fact you can make a video and take so many pics.  You do need to get your on SIM card.  I have gone snorkeling more just to find an excuse to take so many pics of ocean life.  It is clear and the pixels are sharp.  I can even play a slideshow on it which provides music.  Really neat.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for travelling
Reviews.Author: Michael Rogers
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a week now.It is a great camera for travelling. It is not too large and it does look stylish.I used it when I recently went tubing down springs in Florida and it worked very well. It's neat to look at the lcd screen while above water while taking pictures and jumping from water shots to above watershots seeminglessly.The only issue I have with the camera thus far is that the LCD screen already has a small scratch on it. I assumed it would be durable like the iphone screens and wouldn't scratch so easily. I now ordered a LCD Screen Clear plastic cover so that it will pick up any future scratches. I would suggest ordering one along with the camera, if you decide to purchase it. I like keeping anything I have as new as possible and wish I would have known I needed a cover.

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot, but video does suffer a bit
Reviews.Author: Saved by Jesus
Reviews.Content: I recently went down to my local electronics retailer to pick one of these cameras up (I need the camera soon, and I'm not sure I have time to deal with shipping back and forth in cast there's any problem).  I've read plenty of reviews and I'm reasonably happy with most of what I've read about the camera.But anyone doing any research into this camera will come across reviews where people report on some unwelcome noise in video recordings.  If you look on YouTube you should be able to find a few videos taken by the TG-1 that demonstrate the problem.  I haven't found any TG-2 videos that try to reproduce the problem, and reviews that mention the subject seem to indicate that the problem is subdued or non-existent in the TG-2.  Having a relatively short return window I did some quick tests.So was there any noise in my TG-2 videos?  Short answer is yes, there is.  But in my opinion it's not that bad, and probably not anything that will make me return the camera.  There are two types of noise I encounteredZooming - When the camera zooms you can hear the noise of the servo motor.  It's not all that loud, but certainly noticeable.  This may be a side-effect of folded optics in a tough waterproof case as opposed to the extending lens assembly of more conventional point and shoot cameras.  To be honest, what I find worse than the zooming noise is the zooming speed.  It's certainly a tad on the slow side, and I'd like it if the autofocus was a little zippier - it takes a moment or two for the camera to refocus after zooming while doing video recording.Autofocus - In some of the TG-1 video samples I found there was a jackhammer like ticking that could be heard as the autofocus tried to zero in.  In my test videos I was able to reproduce this sound in my TG-2, but honestly it wasn't bad - better than what I had found in TG-1 videos.  It was more noticeable when I was recording in a quiet room, but out in the open with cars and people doing their thing, it didn't seem all that bad.The only other negative point of this camera - it charges and transfers images using a proprietary USB cable.  But I ordered an external charger with two spare batteries to help with that, and the camera supports EyeFi memory cards so if I get one of those later, I should have almost no need for the cable.Those are the only negative points of the camera I could come up with, and in my opinion they are outweighed by the positives - fast lens, aperture priority, high speed video recording, lots of fun effects modes, good image quality for a tough camera - both stills and video.  But then still shots are more important to me than video - if video recording is important to you then maybe the noise thing may be more of a purchase factor.  But in my case it looks like I'll be keeping this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Sean Adams
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. Its perfect for for the outdoorsman who likes to capture pictures of thier adventures. I love Hiking, Fishing, Riding dirt bikes and Hunting and this camera can handle the tough and rugged environments. I couldn't be happier with this product!

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Parker
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this camera.  I was hesitant to use it in water but, while on a cruise and snorkeling in Labadee, decided to take a risk.  Worked perfectly.  I'm still learning to use the features but, so far, it far exceeds my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Wow - this is great!
Reviews.Author: K.K "TheCheese"
Reviews.Content: After watching a bunch of online reviews we settled on the Olympus Stylus TG-2.  One of the reviews showed it taking a video and being dropped, walked on, and Frozen/thawed.  Good thing it is tough - I dropped in on day one and it bounced off rocks into a mud puddle!!!  Still works great!  I am looking at buying a soft silacone case asap.  I recommend this to anyone who's hands get too cold to hang on to a camera while hiking and it slips out of your grip and bounces 3 times on rocks into 4 inches of water (not that this actually happened to me last month).

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Sloth
Reviews.Content: Does horribly when there's light...even if it's just street lights in the background.  It blurs when there's light and sometimes when there isn't.  The only you can do when it blurs is turn it off and on again, hoping this time it'll focus.  Also, the contrast is super high, making all your subjects super dark.  If you ever take a picture outside, regardless of whether or not it's a sunny or cloudy day, the camera will always focus on the sky and not your subject, meaning half your photo will be high resolution sky and half pitch black (your subject)My biggest gripe though, is that I've only had it for four months and already it's malfunctioning.  Half the times when I turn it on, the shutter malfunctions and blocks the lens, thus making the screen dark.300 dollars is definitely not a reasonable upgrade from the 200 dollar TG-820 which I loved so much.  I accidentally got that model ran over a car and yet it still worked for a couple more months.  I think I'm going to go back to that camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, good option for trips to beaches and water parks
Reviews.Author: K. T.
Reviews.Content: This camera allowed us to take pictures we never could have gotten otherwise. The pictures are very very good outside, and the video is pretty good as well. Never took pictures underwater, though. But the camera did get wet, and survived just fine. I recommend getting the extras, like the floating wrist strap. We plan on taking it to water parks also, but it got a workout on our canoeing trip.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT...
Reviews.Author: Deb in the Adirondacks, NY "vtgrnmts"
Reviews.Content: 54 yr old photographer here........Had Nikons and every other kind of camera also......This camera is fantastic period. I bought it for the close focus capabilities and fast lens. The waterproof and shockproof features are just frosting on top.....The photo results are amazing and the thing is rugged. knocked this around quite a bit and it still is perfect........you will not be disappointed.......

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera for backpacking
Reviews.Author: Allison Dubenezic
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for two reasons.  One, it is a weatherproof and shockproof camera (which does come with limitations I have discovered).  I enjoy hiking and backpacking and wanted a camera that could withstand rain, snow, sand, cold temperatures, and everything else imaginable. This camera puts me at ease...I can throw it in my pocket/pack or hang it around my neck on a lanyard and not worry about it getting scratched up.  It has a sturdy feel to it, which I prefer. It takes wonderful photos of landscapes (the panorama feature is a huge bonus).Number two, the macro abilities are amazing on this camera.  It can get up to 1cm away from an object and take a very detailed shot.  I take photos of plants and flowers, so this is the best feature that it offers to me.  The quality really is sharp and vibrant, but natural.I bought this camera on Amazon because I was given an Amazon gift card.  This is my first experience with Amazon and they have been outstanding.  I dropped the camera (from my hand at a height of 4 feet off the ground) on a greenhouse floor the other day, and, to my surprise, the corner of the camera cracked.  This seems to be a design flaw since the aluminum casing covers only the front and back of the camera.  The corners appear to be made of plastic (and the chance that the camera will fall on these corners seems very high).  The aluminum is very shiny (in the red color at least); at first this troubled me, since it looked very scratch-able...but the aluminum part of the camera does seem quite durable.  Despite the shockproof limitations, I really do love this camera.  I don't intend to use it for underwater purposes, but it serves my needs for a rain and snowproof camera very well.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT buy from Electronics Basket...ripoff company!
Reviews.Author: A. C. Williamson
Reviews.Content: They refuse to take a no working unit back!...They keep saying they have sent a return label but they haven't, they will not provide an address or phone number to reach them! BUYER BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: Soft focus, returned the camera
Reviews.Author: GadgetGuy
Reviews.Content: Mechanically well built but very soft focus. In fact the resolution/focus was worse than a cheap Canon SD1100 (10Mpix) bought in ~2008. Took lots of images to compare the cameras and got consistent results. You'd expect some progress in image quality over the years. Returned the camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Janine B. Sauer "J. Sauer"
Reviews.Content: Having used a lot of different point and shoot cameras, this is the must have one. I am very picky when it comes to cameras and functionality...you can't go wrong with this one especially for the price. We looked at the Nikon waterproof at Costco, but given the poor reviews, we opted for this one. Very much the right choice.We just got back from a week in Hawaii and used this camera more than the Canon SLR. This little guy went every where with us...pool, beach, snokeling, shallow diving, etc. The camera shutter speed is quite fast for a point and shoot. Lots of fun and easy settings as well. From the other reviews, we did leave the GPS off and did not have any trouble with battery life. We recharged every night and did not need an extra battery.The only really minor downsides are the wheel to change modes is hard to turn if you fingers are wet. Also, I do wish there was more control of the flash for fill-in on some of the different SCI settings. That said under the P setting, you can pretty much program anything, so there is a way to achieve the right flash fill and other settings.If you are looking for an all around great little point and shoot that can go anywhere, I would highly recommend taking a close look at this one.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: ray85
Reviews.Content: I was originally hesitant about purchasing this camera due to the price, but my wife and I were prepping for a trip to Cancun where we planned on doing several aquatic/outdoor activities, so we decided to go ahead and fork over the $$$.  I will say, that we were both extremely happy with it's performance and with the quality of the photos overall once we got the hang of the different settings. The camera is ready to shoot almost instantaneously after being turned back on, which is great when there is something that you don't want to miss and the quality of the pictures were great for a point and shoot.  For all intensive purposes, this camera performed exactly how I wanted it to for our trip and then some.  It was a great purchase and would recommend it to anyone that is looking for a nicer point and shoot camera that can also take a beating and keep going.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Wayne Parmley
Reviews.Content: I fish a lot and finally have the right camera for all the shots I want to get! Tons of great features overall, maybe too many! Do not over look the fact this camera has a very fast lens, that was the final key that lead me to going with this camera. Do not over look that feature, often my nicest fish come at dusk as the light is fading and I am very surprised just how dark it has to be before the flash needs to be used. And I would say my very favorite feature is the extreme close up mode, if you like close detail shots of things such as bugs, plants, flowers, etc. this does a great job. I am shooting a lot more photographs since getting my hands on this camera. Also, I would recommend getting a large card for that reason, I went with a 32.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Knepper
Reviews.Content: I was anxious to get one of these cameras and was not disappointed. This is a great, tough and solid camera. I have not tried it under water but feel certain it would do well. Everything else about it is very good. You will read about some background noise when shooting videos and it is caused by using the zoom feature on the camera as the very sensitive microphone picks up the noise when zooming in and out. I don't shoot many videos, but to help that problem I either avoid zooming in when shooting a video and you can also just walk closer to the subject instead of zooming in. It's not a big deal to me, even with the background noise. Again I am pleased that Olympus switched to the SD card instead of the XD cards they used in years past. Two reasons, the SD card is available almost anywhere at a reasonable price, and the next reason is, I use a lot of Trail Cameras and they all use SD cards. You can just pop the SD card from your trail camera into the Olympus camera and view your trail camera photos right there in the field. Very handy feature. The on/off button on this camera is bigger and much easier to turn on and off than some of the older models were. Another feature I like on this camera is that I shoot a lot of self timer photos in my hunting ventures. Once you set this camera on self timer, it stays on self timer till you turn that feature off or turn the camera off. Some of the older Olympus cameras you had to turn the self timer on for each shot you took. That was pretty cumbersome and not so handy. My major use of this camera is for taking photos and this camera takes great sharp clear photos. It is a simple no brainer operating camera. If you are a little bit technology challenged you will find this camera easy to operate. I had trouble showing my videos at first and called the Olympus support group and they were very helpful. I had not downloaded the Olympus set up software on my computer. After I did that everything went smooth. You have to watch your videos on the Olympus software on your computer. The software disc comes free with the camera and the operating manual is on that disc also. You also have to have Quick Time on your computer to use the software and that is available as a free download on line.  You can look at your photos on the Windows Photo Viewer or the Olympus software. I don't think you will go wrong with this camera if you want an easy to operate point and shoot camera that takes great quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher M. Wade
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, learning the settings is a must though. For those complaining about too much noise, change the compression from Standard to Fine and it should fix it. I don't have any issues with noise while taking video or with video after having taken it into the water. I do take 1 star off because they left out the MultiRecording feature that the less expensive TG-830iHS contains (both of these models were announced at the same time).In all honesty, I am amazed at how little it needs to use the flash, even in Auto mode. In places where most cameras would use a flash, this doesn't. Overall, I think the camera is a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Craig Beck "geek"
Reviews.Content: * low light modes are terrible as the camera cant seem to focus and it cant seem to decide when it needs a flash (not that it's helped)* bezel ring around lens comes off too easily. So far I'm just lucky I haven't lost it.* 'SCN' mode is too easy to switch modes accidentally e.g. switching to panorama mode unintentionally* panorama mode is near worthless. The in-camera stitching leaves very visible seams and does a poor job across scenes with differing exposure needs (i.e. pretty much every pan aroma I've ever shot)* GPS can be wildly inaccurate. Location from Mt Baker (Emmonds Glacier) put the location miles away for some shots (zero tree cover - it's a glacier, nothing getting in way of signal)* dial on back of camera for selecting shooting modes is a bit hard to turn sometimes due to small size and lack of texture on edge (for grip)* on/off button is problematically close to shutter button when using gloves and can be easy to accidentally turn off when shooting* the screen has failed in less than 6 weeks (used on 6 or so outings). Still haven't dealt with Olympus support so can't report anything about this, although I cant think of a single thing electronics-wise (other than a hard-drive) that has ever failed me and required service like this

Reviews.Title: Was ridiculously good until it lasted for a week
Reviews.Author: thatsallfolks
Reviews.Content: Took it for my honeymoon to Tahiti. I was sooo impressed by the quality and different fun filters and options that I started using it over my Sony NEX5N. Took unbelievable underwater pics and great sunset and scenario pics as well. Everything was just perfect until it started acting up. The screen got messed up and it started to freeze while recording or taking pics with filter. This started happening while I was riding bike on a hill so I can rule out the water leakage problem. It stemmed the processor cannot handle video while you are on magic filter. And while we are on the video I must say the quality sucks for a 1080p. Maybe I am spoiled by my NEX5N, but its definitely not acceptable. And night pictures are mediocre as well. The biggest problem I see is that the gorgeous screen make you think night pics are amazing but when you checkout the pics on computer you'll notice they are grainy and not as clear as you thought they would be. So anyways the camera is pretty awesome for the price and quality of pics in daytime or underwater is exceptionally good. I would deff recommend buying this camera and give it a try. Maybe mine was defective. I will buy again when they revise this version though.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, compared with Canon D10...
Reviews.Author: darping "darping"
Reviews.Content: I'm the kind of person, while in tune with current technology, usually studies the durability/ruggedness of a product before analyzing components to the pixel level. My first ruggedized camera was a Canon D10. I liked the canon for the fat body, larger buttons, and the durability/waterproofing. This camera lasted about 8 months. Never really dropped far, never in cold weather, and survived multiple snorkling trips before succombing to a dive trip off of Catalina island. Since my warrenty was up and after reading many bad reviews about Canon's sevice I decided to take it apart and found that the seal around the main casing leaked...none of the doors failed.Having said this my 4 stars are cautious as I have yet to dive with the T2. However, I do not share some of the complaints that I have read about this camera. For a P&R; it's very good but a bit too pricey....But, again, I would pay extra for the durability. The noisey video is not "that" bad. You have to be pretty anal to be as bothered as some are with this. Also, there is a wind filter for the Audio that really helps, did the 1 and 2 stars people find this? The white balance settings are good and effective, again, not as bad as some say. Bulky?? I hope so! It would be impossible for a man that is diving with gloves on to operate a camera with little girly buttons... This camera in my opinion is still small, and the buttons small too...you really have to make sure what you're pressing with gloves on. I know there is a waterproof housing you can get that bulks it up and provides larger controls, but it's 300$(rip)!! The software bundled with it is good. The view screen is nice and big, larger than my drowned Canon. Takes pictures "fast"! I have had no bad "auto" issues as some have said...whether it be auto focus or white balance. Over all, exactly what I need, "but" a little small and controls even smaller, overpriced accessories, camera itself overpriced (especially if you are someone that never leaves the house to take advantage of the camera's ruggedness, plays video games all day, and only really worries about dropping the camera in the toilet). I may follow up on this as I take this camera on a few adventures and test it's claims of "tough".

Reviews.Title: noisy sound recording
Reviews.Author: Raffia
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this camera. I bought it mainly as a travel camera and because it is waterprrof, freeze proof, drop proof, dust proof etc. It takes pretty good pictures.There is a major problem with the sound recording. There is a constant hum and it grinds, pings, beeps and makes mini jack hammer sounds when it tries to auto focus. The sounds are more than noticable when the video is played back. It also makes a loud buzzing noise when you zoom in and out.These sound issues make the video basically worthless on this camera.If olympus fixes these sound issues than this would be the perfect travel camera. In its current state it definitely is not

Reviews.Title: Not for video
Reviews.Author: James B. Young "JBYoung Photography"
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in this camera to shoot video, don't buy it.  It suffers from the same defect as its predecessor the TG-1.  There is a loud clicking sound in the audio track during recording, which appears to be related to the auto focus mechanism.  Strangely, the noise does not occur all the time.  Owners of the TG-1 complained about this problem in mass, but Olympus claimed it was just part of the design and could not be fixed.  I purchased the TG-2 in the hope and expectation that they had found a way to fix the problem.  Not so. I returned the camera after one day of testing.  If you are buying this camera just for still photography, I think it does a nice job.  The close up capability is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Major Focusing Issues - Do not buy
Reviews.Author: M. SUKUMARAN "Manoj"
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY - Not A Good Product.I bought my TG2 on Monday, September 23, 2013. Except for testing at home have tried to use it on my trip last week. It shot the first couple of photos fine and then the zoom stopped working. It would zoom but was totally out of focus and the green focus lock would not come. If I took the photo it was still out of focus.  I restarted & shot a photo without zooming, but as soon as I zoomed, no matter how little I zoomed, everything went out of focus. I tried restarting, reset from menu, different SD card - NOTHING HELPS!!  I tried several shooting modes with no sign of improvements. Issue is intermittent. It works for few photos using zoom with no problems but after that any use of zoom lever resulting in out of focus.  Tried to contact Olympus through email - it doesnt work either. Unfortunately as an apparently intermittent problem, if I send it Olympus for service it may probably work for them. I am trying to contact Olympus in all possible ways.

Reviews.Title: If you want to go snorkeling, GET THIS CAMERA, but be prepared for some issues.
Reviews.Author: Tony Fabris
Reviews.Content: First things first: Camera is perfect for underwater snorkeling photos. Very impressive.I just got back from a weeklong trip to Kaua'i, where we went snorkeling several times, and this camera produced perfect photos underwater. Remember to set your White Balance to "underwater" and this thing just works flawlessly. Set it to Aperture priority, set it to "action" focusing mode, put in a big memory card, and snapsnapsnapsnap and then cull the blurred photos later. The battery lasts plenty long for an afternoon of snorkeling with tons of exposures, with the LCD screen on the whole time. Other reviewers have said how their cameras failed somehow, such as letting in water unexpectedly... Mine did not fail, it worked flawlessly and never fogged up or anything. Every time I brought it out of the water, it still looked like it was brand new (remember to follow the instructions and, after taking it in the sea, rinse it with tap water and let it dry before opening it up). It worked underwater just like it worked in the air, without the slightest trouble. It worked so well that my girlfriend, an advanced photographer who has other more advanced/expensive cameras with specialized underwater housings, is planning to get one of these before her next snorkeling trip and use it instead.Next: Camera is decent, but not spectacular, as a happy-snap vacation camera.For all of the other things we did in Kaua'i, including sightseeing and a helicopter trip, the camera worked more or less pretty good. It worked well enough that, although I had brought my big Nikon DSLR along on the trip, I didn't end up using it hardly at all. I wish I could go back in time and tell myself: Don't bother to bring the big kid, the TG-2 will be enough.BUT... for just a plain happy-snap camera I would have been happier with one of the small Canon units. It doesn't zoom as far, doesn't respond in the UI as quickly, and doesn't have a big and bright enough LCD screen. Still... for the compromise that it manages: UNDER F'ING WATER, I think it's pretty amazing. Here's a camera that I just took INTO THE OCEAN and got great photos, and then took it sightseeing and still got pretty good photos. That's an amazing stunt.Another good point: Aperture priority.This is the only happy-snap I know with an aperture priority mode. Considering its size, it's not bad. So for some shots I can just crank open the aperture like I would on a DSLR to let the most light in for certain situations. Kind of impressive. It's doesn't magically give you DSLR quality by a long shot, but, it's not bad for what it is.Now the bad points:- No separate charger.This camera comes with a USB cable and a USB-powering wall puck. In other words, THE CAMERA IS THE CHARGER. This means that you must have the camera plugged into the wall in order to charge its battery. You cannot, for example, buy just a second battery and charge that battery independently while simultaneously using the camera with the first battery. Every other camera I've bought has a separate, independent battery charger which allows me to charge the spare battery back at the hotel while I take the camera on adventures with me. This camera does not. So when you buy this camera, look at the section that says "customers also bought..." and find an actual separate independent charger unit in there somewhere. I was glad I did that.- No "stay-zoomed-while-culling" mode on the LCD screen.One of the most useful features of many cameras (such as Nikons and Canons that I've either owned or played with) is the stay-zoomed-while-browsing feature. This is the ability to zoom into a photo to see whether it's in focus, and then to look at the next photo in the photoset while staying zoomed in, to compare the focus detail from picture to picture. Imagine this: You take five shots of the same thing, and some of them are in focus and some of them are not. You zoom in to a feature in the picture that you want to be in focus. Most cameras have an option so that you can go back and forth between the photos and see which of those photos is the most in focus, while staying zoomed in the whole time. Then you can cull the blurry ones right there, boom, done, no need to go back to the PC. Whereas with this camera, it's like I'm back in time 15 years and now I have some super-old camera. I have to zoom in, look at the focus, zoom out, go to the next picture, zoom in, look at the focus, zoom out, go to the next picture, etc. Very annoying. While we're at it, some modern cameras will even automatically cull the blurry photos for you, so this one is really behind the times.- Cheap plastic ring on the front is too easy to twist off, easy to lose, lets in sand.There is a plastic ring on the front that allows you to remove it to snap in a zoom lens. Well, that ring practically falls off. It takes only a gentle twist to unsnap it, and once, that very thing happened accidentally just as I was getting out of the car to go snorkeling. Luckily, as I was getting back in the car I saw it on the ground and I could rescue it. But it was a close call, I almost lost it.I thought at that point, "well, I guess I don't actually need the ring, it's just for looks anyway". And then I got the camera home, and OMG the amount of sand that I shook out of the gap that the ring covered... Man, there was a ton of sand in there. So, it seems you DO need the ring there when you're snorkeling to keep the sand out of that gap round the lens.- Slow processing speed for HDR photos.This camera has a pretty decent HDR mode! I got some really successful shots with it. But the agony of waiting for the HDR processing after each shot... ew. It takes far too long to process the HDR photos and you can't do anything with the camera while it processes.- HDR photos reduce the resolution.I only realized this after the fact: Even though I had the camera set to 3968x2976, when I did an HDR shot I noticed the resulting photos were 1920x1440. Too bad because the HDR photo results are quite decent.- Terrible in-camera panorama mode.Although it tries to guide you to line up the shots, if you don't get them lined up exactly, the borders between the frames will be terrible blurred messes. Also the camera does not try to straighten the photos out if you don't take them all perfectly lined up to the horizon. And yet it still seems to take forever to process the panoramas, much like it takes forever to process the HDR photos: You're staring at a progress bar for what seems like an eternity.- On screen menus take forever to scroll through.The most-used "Scene" modes that I used on this camera were, HDR, Panorama, and Sunset. (I actually really liked the Sunset mode on this camera, made the colors more vibrant.) They put HDR and Panorama next to each other in the menu, but I had to scrollscrollscrollscroll forever to get to "sunset". And when photographing a sunset, sometimes you're deliberately popping back and forth between HDR and Sunset for different reasons. So that's a lot of unnecessary scrolling as the precious seconds tick away and the sun slips slowly below the horizon.I know, I know, I should be doing my HDR processing, and my sunset color processing, and my panorama processing, all back at the PC. And sure, you can do that with this camera too. For that matter I should be culling my shots on the PC and not on the camera. But this is a happy-snap camera that should be making life wonderful for the user. There are other companies out there doing all these things on-camera, much better than this one can.But... still... overall...Dude, I took this camera to Hawaii AND IT WAS THE ONLY CAMERA I NEEDED. Seriously, this thing hits a perfect sweet spot in its compromises. It can go IN THE OCEAN and then also can be your bang-around-the-island camera, and it JUST WORKS. How awesome is that?

Reviews.Title: Ex Navy Combat Photographer.
Reviews.Author: Thomas A Gibbins
Reviews.Content: I know cameras. There are a Lot of complicated cameras that people use as simple point and shoot and never take advantage of the incredible features. That said. If you want a camera that will do everything you want it to do and you can learn and play with it in about 1/2 hour, this is it! This is a wonderful camera. Great for underwater photos and videos (with a housing) (why risk a $370 camera when you don't have to?) As far as a video camera, I took our wedding vids with it and pulled stills off of those.  Realistically, If you want a video camera go buy one. But for stills under various light and action conditions you cannot go wrong. As far as people saying it leaked the first time on a dive, etc. Well it is built to be waterproof to fifty feet or so. If you have one speck of dust or one micro fiber from a towel you just threw away your camera. Buy a housing. Treat it like you are building a space shuttle when you put it all together. Use it hard and clean it all up when you are done. Take care of your investment and it will work great and provide you with wonderful photos!

Reviews.Title: Tg-1 and tg-2 appear to be the same and not having great luck
Reviews.Author: Ramsey "Would rather be living in Costa Rica"
Reviews.Content: I'm really disappointed in my TG-1. I just mailed it out to El Paso, TX this afternoon for warranty repair. I'm completely bummed... Summer is short in Minnesota and will not have my camera for use for my summer fun activities I purchased it for. I have only used it a few times and was on vacation with my family in San Diego when the back buttons stopped working. I have sent a letter via certified mail to explain my frustrations with Olympus and this model... I'm not the first customer to take their camera to the beach and then realize that the back buttons no longer work. No menus... no videos... nothing. I think this is a great camera, just don't get it wet, and make sure you have a backup camera for when this one falls apart or stops working.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade to my Olympus TG 8000
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of nice features as fas as a tough camera can have.  This one at least you can set the aperture & iso however you still cannot set the shutter speed. You can get around by messing around with the iso speeds and in a crude way this will change the shutter speed but I don't like using high ISO unless its for astrophotography because you never know what picture you might want to have blown up.  It does have a slight buzzing noise while zooming in and out during video but I don't plan on using this as my primary video camera or if I do I won't zoom in or out.  I have tested under water pictures but only to a few feet down and I have tested in the snow.  The super macro feature is actually quite good.  The only feature that I don't really want to test is dropping it from 6 feet.  I never dropped my old tough camera from more than a foot.  The 2.0 lens makes focusing quick. The GPS was quick for me but I don't know if it will drain the battery too fast.  The custom buttons features can be saved but you don't make the changes under the custom buttons you make the changes elsewhere and can save to button 1 or 2.  Not where I thought that would be.  I like it so far it may be bulky for some people but for people that can be quite accident prone this is a good camera to have.

Reviews.Title: My new travel companion
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Stoll
Reviews.Content: Took this camera with me on our cruise to Alaska.  I was not disappointed with any photo I took with it.  I was able to carry it in the pocket of my pants or jacket without feeling bulky or heavy.  Feels solid in my hand.  The different options available helped to make some memorable photos.  The GPS never failed and was a blessing to have.  I am unable to think of a negative thing to say about this camera.  It is going with us when we travel to Italy next summer.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera
Reviews.Author: meh
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I love this little camera. It's got a high image quality, shoots HD video, has a long battery life, and its rugged and waterproof. It also has GPS tracking, an altimeter and a compass and a very long battery life. I took it on my 2 week honeymoon in Scandanavia and never had any problems with it.the panorama shooting mode allows for some nice panoramas and it has a plethora of customized shooting options, including, portrait, landscape, food, nightshot, fireworks, underwater, underwater portrait, HDR and plenty of others.I've had fun taking underwater shots.  It's 4x optical zoom works in all cases, both under water and above water.If you're looking for a rugged compact little camera that you can take with you in pretty much any situation, I'd recommend giving the TG-2 a long hard look.Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Tough camera with compromises
Reviews.Author: gadget-o-holic
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife.  I chose this camera mostly because it is labeled as a tough camera that can take a beating.  Since my wife is always throwing her camera in her purse, her cameras have historically taken a beating from all the shuffling around.  We've had this camera now for several months and I have to say that it has held up quite well.  I've used it underwater once and did not have any issues with it.In adequate lighting environments this camera does well in capturing moments but in any low light situation this camera is not great.  We took it to a concert a few months ago and the camera performed poorly.  It could not focus and when I could take a picture the flash was so bright that it washed everything out in the pictures captured.It may be that I did not spend enough time trying to figure out how to get good pics in low light with this camera or how to effectively use the flash but really the pictures were so bad that I threw most of them out.  That being said, I didn't really buy this camera for low light pictures but I would have expected to get something usable.  As such I'm going to give the camera 3 stars as I think it's a good camera for specific purposes and it should hold up very well to abuse over time.

Reviews.Title: Storng Entry in Compact All Weather Class
Reviews.Author: TJD "tjdusa"
Reviews.Content: Bought the TG-2 for a vacation in Guadeloupe in the French Caribbean. Did not have time to really familiarize myself with the camera before the trip, and used it in auto mode only. Even in auto mode, the resulting images showed the potential for this camera. I used it extensively while snorkeling in the Jacques Cousteau Underwater Park and the photos were very good, both in sharpness and color. With more experience and using the manual settings, There was little shutter lag and the camera turns off and on quickly (to conserve power). I hope to get excellent pictures in the future. I had no issues whatsoever with leakage; however, those using it in the ocean should adhere to Olympus' instruction to soak the camera in fresh water after using it in the ocean (probably to avoid salt crystals and problems with getting good watertight seals). The battery life is relatively short compared to more mainstream point and shoots, but I feel that this is a minor negative. Recommend highly to anyone seeking a "cross-over" camera. The biggest negative is that they don't include a hardcopy manual; I spent an extra $10 and ordered one directly from Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Great for what it is
Reviews.Author: Alicia
Reviews.Content: The key thing to understand about this camera is that it's really about $250 of camera in $150 worth of protection. The toughness is the key feature, and the other features really have to fit within. That said, it's extremely versatile for being a "tough" camera, and the resulting pictures are better than almost any others in the category.Good Things: - Very Tough - Fast f/2 lens - Ability to add converter lenses - Good battery life - Turns on quickly and very short delay between picturesBad things: - Poor sound quality in videos/noiseThe reason I got this camera was so I could go hiking, backpacking, biking, etc., while taking good pictures and not having to constantly fuss with a camera when the weather turns bad, or there's a lot of dust, or it's freezing. I love being able to take landscape shots with the extra wide angle lens. This is a pretty perfect camera for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Decent waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: M. R. Ramos
Reviews.Content: The colors were bright and much, much better than the disposable waterproof cameras we used to buy. It performed ok when in water throughout most of our trip, except for one time when the display screen wouldn't always work. It's also a bit heavier than I expected but I guess that's part of its ruggedness.

Reviews.Title: My Olympus
Reviews.Author: katty kang
Reviews.Content: The picture quality could be better. The filter are really nice. the micro option work really well. Overall, I like this camera

Reviews.Title: Just fine.
Reviews.Author: Cheri King
Reviews.Content: Seems to work like it should.Do not like the wrist strap, but otherwise am happy with it . . . if you can tell about something in 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good.....
Reviews.Author: T. Jacobson
Reviews.Content: So far we had good luck with this camera. I bought in March and took snorkeling in Maui in April without any issues. Picture quality is what you would expect with a point and shoot type of camera, but the pictures pretty much underwater and above were all very nice. This is going to be our backup camera for all our traveling going forward.

Reviews.Title: I've thad them all when it comes to underwater point and shoot cameras
Reviews.Author: Vivian Le
Reviews.Content: We have a gopro, nikon, canon, polaroid, and the olympus tough. It really is tough. My major complaint is that the sticker that indicates the setting/mode of the camera came off but I don't blame it. We live in hawaii and use this camera every day when we go diving, spearing, surfing, swimming, you name it. This camera has always consistently captured beautiful shots. I love the red exterior color because we've dropped the camera so often that it makes diving for it easy.

Reviews.Title: its ok...
Reviews.Author: Jim L. Bigelow
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this camera, I replaced my old 790sw that was a great camera for me. I just have to keep fighting with this camera to take a normal picture, its either to bright or to dark... I messed around with it on my vacation and lost a bunch of great pictures because this camera did not want to take a good picture, where my 790sw was just point and shoot no messing around with settings...

Reviews.Title: nonworking camera
Reviews.Author: charlotte scarbrough
Reviews.Content: amazon sent a replacement..still has same problem with memory card. will not release when pushed . poor battery connection.  $329 for camera and cannot use it

Reviews.Title: terrific camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: There's a lot to like about this camera - it's durable, and at f/2.0 (at the wide end) the lens is relatively fast, it responds quickly whether you're taking pictures or reviewing them, has long battery life, and adjustments like toggling the flash, adjusting the white balance or exposure compensation are relatively easy to get to.  Image quality and color are both very good, for this type of camera.  It may be incrementally bigger and heavier than equivalent non-rugged cameras.  Its "panorama" function works well enough, but it's quite a bit clunkier than Sony's implementation.  Overall, it's a fantastic camera for carefree use outdoors, and very good for general use as well.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Gary D Williams Jr
Reviews.Content: This is the best all round waterproof camera I have found.The pictures were phenomenal. The camera has a bunch of options and covers every need.My underwater pictures were way better than my friends "equivalent" underwater rated camera.I did a lot of research prior to purchasing this camera and all the reviews were dead on.This is one Awesome camera.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Great quality. Lots of great scenes and aperture mode is great. I have it in the water all the time and no leaks.

Reviews.Title: Camera leaks on 2nd vacation . . .
Reviews.Author: Moises C. Esguerra III
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera from a local distributor due to very nice reviews on the net. Used it for a convention in Palawan islands (Philippines) and everyone was very positive about the picture quality underwater and as a general purpose camera.However, the camera leaked water on just my second vacation using this.  After surviving several sea water snorkeling trips in my first use, the camera's seals apparently failed with just a short romp on the beach. . .Local distributor was not optimistic on Olympus service honoring its warranty, but I sent it in for service/warranty claim anyway. . .In any case, I am extremely disappointed with the camera in general, as I am likely facing a write off.  Will bever buy an Olympus waterproof camera again.(Just so you know I am not an Olympus hater . . . I have an OMD EM-5 and that camera has been a very nice travel companion.  Though with my experience with the Tough TG-2, I will likely be reluctant to try out its "splashproof/rainproof" feature anytime soon.)

Reviews.Title: Best pix
Reviews.Author: S. Brown "S. Brown"
Reviews.Content: Best pictures. Love this camera. My only complaint, you cant see the screen when you're underwater. I had such a hard time. By the time I got back to land, I saw that a lot of the pictures didnt come out, or looked gritty. Still, the camera does take amazing land photos.

Reviews.Title: Great versatile camera
Reviews.Author: JodiSu
Reviews.Content: Used this snorkeling for hours as well as otherwise on vacation.  The pics are clear, and the camera is easy to use.  I also bought the underwater housing for diving and am glad that I did.  It works great for diving, but it is nice to just take this compact camera for snorkeling as well.  Travels well.

Reviews.Title: Zoom is non-existant
Reviews.Author: Lisa R. Stine "Total Travel"
Reviews.Content: I like it takes photos underwater.  I like that it is a small size and has a decent screen.  But its zoom is bad.  I bought the attachment zoom lens which doesn't do much either.  It was a waste of money.  I like the camera but taking photos from more than a few feet away is just frustrating.

Reviews.Title: High hopes, dashed by poor HDR and panoramic photos, mediocre standard photos, and other issues.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey H. Jordan "Jeff Jordan"
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera, but I'd return it if I could.The main issue is the photo quality. It's just not that good. I take a lot of high dynamic range (HDR) photos, and the specs said it comes with an HDR setting. What they don't tell you is that the photos are only 3MP photos. My Samsung Note smartphone takes better photos. Even standard photos are not as good as what my Samsung Note takes.Panaramics on the Stylus are a nightmare. Not matter how straight you keep the horizon, the panoramic photo it stitches together it usually "bent" at the ends by about 20-30 degrees. By contrast, my phone takes perfect panoramics.The menus are complicated, and so it takes a while to even dial up the setting you want. When you choose a setting at long last, you are encounted by a stock photo that hovers on the screen far too long. Perhaps there's a way to get rid of this, but do I need so see a photo of a dog blocking the view I want to photograph to know this is the dogs setting?This is supposed to be a "tough" camera too, but the first time I wandered into the water (the camera was never deeper than one foot deep), when I returned to shore, the ring around the lens was missing. I didn't bump anything either. It apparently just fell off.Also, all my photo times were off, because even though it has GPS and knows where I am, it doesn't change the time zone of the photos when you change time zones. My smartphone does this automarically.I paid almost $400 for this camera. It's worth about $150 at best. I would happily return it for a refund if I could get even most of my money back for it. Olympus, what do you say?

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures underwater
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to Tahiti and it takes great pictures outdoor and when used the underwater mode, the pictures turned out amazing!!! I would give this camera a five star except that when using the video mode, you can hear the camera when it zoom in and out.  The worst complaint I have about this camera is when we were using it underwater, we can't see the LCD screen!! Basically, we were shooting it blind underwater, and yes we have the LCD screen turned on to the brightest setting.

Reviews.Title: Great Durable Camera
Reviews.Author: Lu
Reviews.Content: For most situations, I've found that my phone camera works just fine.  I'm not one to dread over photo quality too much.  From my experience, if I wanted a camera with the best quality photos, I would go with a DSLR.  I figure if I was going to buy a point and shoot camera, I would buy one that I can use in situations where I cannot use my phone.While shopping around for a durable waterproof camera, I narrowed it down to goPro or TG-2.  There are a lot of reviews out there that put all the specifications side by side for the two cameras.  I came to the conclusion that goPro would be better for videos and TG-2 would be better for photos, for my purposes.  That's not to detract photo quality from goPro and video quality from TG-2.  I was actually very impressed with the video quality from the few videos I took with it."Waterproofness": I've read some reviews where some people had leaks when they used it water.  I was fighting every fiber of my being to plunge a brand new camera, or any electronics for that matter, into water to test if it could actually operate underwater.  I'm happy to report, at least with the unit I received, that it functions correctly underwater.  I did not get any leaks, and took some great picture of my tube in water.Quick Shots: One thing I was looking in my next camera is having the ability to start up the camera and take a shot fast.  Too many times I've had moments that passed where I'm waiting for my phone or camera to start, only to miss because it took so long.  With TG-2, it felt like it took about a second to start up the camera and another to take a shot.Scratches: One thing that I'm concerned with is how well the lenses hold up to scratches.  Not having the lens close when shutting the camera down worries me.  Being a durable camera, I can only hope it will hold up well.  I was not brave enough to test this by scratching the lens.Dated: This might be a minor complaint, but I felt the camera feels very dated.  Perhaps it's because I haven't own a camera in a while; mostly taking pictures with my phone, but I feels very slow and  laborious to select different modes and using the buttons to navigate.  I like the quickness of touchscreens; using buttons again to navigate the interface makes the camera feel very dated.  This, however, might be the norms with most camera, so it's more of a personal complaint.Noise: I did not think it would bother me this much.  I've read a lot of the other reviews and I was expecting the noise from zooming in and out when filming.  I also read the microphone for the camera was bad.  Knowing all of that, I was ready for the worst, or so I thought.  My main purpose is not to take videos, so I did not think it would disturb me as much as it did.  The sound is very noticeable, extremely so.  Even with all the background noise reduction turned on in the settings, I've found myself having a hard time hearing the voices over the zooming.  I suppose it bothers me so much because of how surprisingly good the video quality is.  Granted, I still believe if you want a device mainly for video, goPro would be better, I was stun by the sharpness of the video the TG-2 took.  Having such amazing video quality only to be plagued by terrible voice deeply irks me.There were other minor little things that I could talk about, but nothing too major.  I would have prefer a longer charging cable with a better adapter.  The one that came with it seems cheaply made and not what I expected.  The GPS is also not the that great, loosing signal most of the time.  The software allows for manually GPS tagging, which amend for the crappy signal, but still, could have been better implemented.  It makes the GPS and by extension, the landmark feature feel like a cheap gimmick.  The battery also did not last too long for me.  With flash, GPS, and most other features on, the battery lasted close to a day for me.  Etc.  There are also a lot of many great little things about the camera.  I like the tapping feature of it, which allow you to tap the sides of the camera to perform different actions.  I found this somewhat makes up for the touch features.Overall, I think this camera is great for what it's designed to do; take picture in somewhat extreme environments.  For all it's faults, it has many great features.Pros.Durable and waterproofQuick, very quickSurprisingly excellent video capturePlethora of different shooting modesCons.Noise when zoomingLens very exposedDated interfaceGPS signal is poor most of the timePoor battery lifeTiny buttons

Reviews.Title: Nice camera if you only expect it to work for a week or two
Reviews.Author: harper
Reviews.Content: Used this camera twice before it quit working.  Would have never purchased it had I realized it was assembled in China.  Trying to send it back for repair now, we'll see how well that works.

Reviews.Title: GREAT little camera
Reviews.Author: Suze
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It takes great photos in all lighting.  I haven't tried all the different modes yet but those that I have used are wonderful.  GREAT, GREAT, GREAT!

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC active lifestyle / everyday camera!
Reviews.Author: GoodGuy
Reviews.Content: I was looking for the following characteristics and this camera has all of them:- Compact, being able to fit the pocket or to be carried everywhere to catch unique moments,- Good party photos (low light, a lot of movement),- Water/sand/dust proof (I can use it on a beach or near water and not to worry about anything).I'm very pleased with the overall good quality of photos in almost any condition. The more I use it, the more I like it.No issues with the ring as some users reported, it's quite firmly staying there unless I willingly remove it.I already used it dozens of time in sea water, absolutely no issues, it's working perfectly and the footage is great. Of course, read the manual and take care of the camera according to it.I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Broke on second use
Reviews.Author: Rad Jersean "Techo-SciFi-Music Dude"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my first diving trip as a newly certified recreational diver.  On land and underwater - the pictures were STUNNING.  I loved the features and the battery life.  The fish-eye lens and foam float strap made for excellent accessories.  It was just amazing until my second day of diving when the depth warning went off at 20 feet, when we never descended beyond 25 feet, and by the time we were back to the boat it had stopped working.  Somehow, water had gotten through all the fancy locks and seals and that was the end of it.  I stopped into a camera shop that caters to divers.  I loved the TG-2 so much that I figured I'd just buy another and return the defective one when we got back home.  I asked the owner if he had any TG-2s in stock.  His response, "I sent them all back. They leak."

Reviews.Title: Decent product, improves over its predecessors poor performance
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: A substantial improvement over the last 2 Olympus Tough camera's I've owned, notably in the performance category.  Olympus seems to have fixed the disastrously long latency from power on to taking a picture (~6-8 seconds) in its predecessor.The biggest complaint, as with all Olympus products, continues to be their baffling usage of proprietary USB plugs for charging/computer connections.  Not only is having to carry around another set of cables a pain when they could have used the USB micro standard, but the cable is very finicky about which power supplies will actually charge the battery, maybe 50% at best not counting the $0.75 quality charging block provided with the camera package itself.Lack of a lens cap is surprising.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: spiffdandy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily as a waterproof underwater filming camera.  It also came in extremely useful for family pics while on the beach and in the surf.  ( no worries if its raining also) . I have had if for about 4 months now and we have had many cameras over the years and have 4 besides this one.  The quality of picture was beyond our expectation.  We read alot of reviews before buying this camera and tho most were good or great,  I feel this camera deserves more recognition.  No delay on camera click when taking pictures.  Easy to use and very user friendly.  Videos were great,  above and below water.  My wife now says this is 'her' camera.  Battery life lasted longer than any camera Ive owned,  impressive battery time.  If we lost this camera tomorrow we would replace it with the same thing.  Excellent camera,  totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: Hip pocket tough
Reviews.Author: onokapu
Reviews.Content: This is my third Olympus "tough" kind camera (the first was lost at bottom of waterfall in muddy water while cliff diving -another person, not me- and the second filled with salt water due to operator error -me- when I didn't seal the battery compartment.) I especially like the double locking system so the "operator error" is more difficult but primary benefit of this camera over my previous versions is the lens coating (I wish it had a built in cover) that reduces water spotting. Works Great.Other things I especially like about the camera, and telephoto lens I also purchased for it, is that the special scene modes match the way I primarily shoot [sunsets, bright beaches, and hand held night shots] and works very similar to my prosumer DSLR. I can let the camera's built in sensors adjust for those modes or I can set them manually on both cameras in almost identical ways. Very convenient.I highly recommend this camera, especially if you can get it on sale.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: imola lorincz
Reviews.Content: I little bit unusual it does not have a lens cover, and a bit too automatic (can't set the ISO) but overall, I like it so far.

Reviews.Title: Great Outdoor Camera - Beware of pop-open access panels.
Reviews.Author: E. Borne "Captain Gerard"
Reviews.Content: This is a great outdoor camera.  It is a solid, slightly heavy, camera which feels good in your hand. The lens it comes with gives a good "eyeball" view of what you're shooting, but the 4x zoom is a little low. So guess what, you need to get the optional telephoto lens to deal with your landscapes.  This is why I gave it 4 stars.I love the GPS feature and the Olympus software which has a map feature, that places your pictures on the map via long/lat.  My 16 year old daughter took it to Ecuador right after I got it, and I have a full map of exactly where she took her pictures.  (more on this later)Some photos blur out, the face recognition feature is quite active, so you have to be sure to let the camera focus on something if there are no people in the frame.  The quick snap photo feature can complicate this, because the camera IS fast.  So, I just keep shooting.  The macro view works extremely well.  Get a big SD card and you should do fine.The video button just starts shooting videos like a speed demon.  You won't ever have to worry about missing any kind of shot with this camera.  Do take some time to learn how it's settings affect your shots.I made every effort to get it wet, and it performed well on my fishing trips to the lake.  My daughter's Ecuador trip resulted in many under water shots, but guess what!  She says the side connections door popped open when she slid into the water to chase turtles. She swears she checked it first, but camera drowned.  I sent it back to Olympus with this story, and they replaced it with a refurbished model within a week. I had a red one, they returned a black one, but I love it just the same or better, because the black looks "tougher".  The red one looks like a piece of jewelry.That side door DOES pop open, as it is spring loaded, despite the double lock feature.  I bought a neoprene cover, but it has holes for the 2 access doors.  In a separate review, I will state, as here, who needs the access doors 'accessible' during rough play?  I'd like the cover to 'cover' the entire camera, which might assist in preventing this.Overall, I love the camera, and when I get the zoom lens, the rating should go to 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Francisco Rosales Rueda
Reviews.Content: Haven't been able to try it underwater yet, but its great for taking clinical pictures and some insects too, lol i still haven't figured out why when i take the picture on macro mode and then i wanna zoom in on my PC the picture pixelates faster, but mehhhh good enought for the price, just need to figure out how to get a microscope adapter for this cam

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Audball
Reviews.Content: I only have two complaints about this camera.  It needs a viewfinder and a lens cover.Other than that it is fantastic.  I have amazing photos from a recent backpacking trip and I didn't have to fret about breaking it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: john brandt
Reviews.Content: Really love it, took it to Belize for adventure, captured everything.  One drawback, hard to see what you are shooting at underwater but mostly point and click.  Great images and mini movies.  A word of advice, when snorkeling and taking underwater pictures, get close to subject or keep it on zoom if taking pictures from the surface.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Gonzalo García Escobal
Reviews.Content: Before this camera I had the Olympus 8010, this was a good camera but not what I really wanted. Before I bought the TG-2 I analyzed other brands I can tell you that I didn't make a mistake buying it. It's really great, all problems that I had with 8010 had been  solved in this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Eduardo J. Zambrano
Reviews.Content: Low light capabilities, a little noise in the pictures when you take them at night without a flash, but not bad for a though camera. I would love it even more if a lens protector were included with the camera.

Reviews.Title: user friendly
Reviews.Author: Christy Montgomery
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I had an earlier model of the Olympus Stylus that I have used in heat, underwater, cold, rain...you name it! This camera looks like it will be just as easy to use with the same great pictures and videos....

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Schmuck
Reviews.Content: we loved it and not disappointed in any way.  We are not camera pros, tho....we are just simple users.  took it on a Disney cruise and took great pics in and out of water.  best investment of the trip.

Reviews.Title: Great All Around Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Pao "Isodose"
Reviews.Content: I took this camera with the Fish eye converter to Hawaii. The camera performed extremely well. The landscape photos were excellent. The portraits were also very good.

Reviews.Title: Not useable for Video - horrible noise!
Reviews.Author: DicCarlson
Reviews.Content: Olympus pulled a boner with this camera and it's predecessor the TG 1.  Both cameras take excellent photos and have lots of neat shooting modes, but don't expect anything from the Video.  All video production (except the underwater mode) will come through with a horrible ticking noise.  Turns out it is the auto focus.  Olympus says it's normal and will not honor any return for this reason.  Idiots!

Reviews.Title: Returned item because of poor pciture quality
Reviews.Author: R. Cruz "RC"
Reviews.Content: I have very disappointed with the quality of the pictures indoors.  It uses an ISO so high that the pictures come out very grainy.  I also don't like that it has lens cover so it immediately got junk on the lens.

Reviews.Title: Broke on day three
Reviews.Author: Shantanu Rana
Reviews.Content: This camera was fine, while it worked.This is the third Olympus though camera that I have had.  The first one died due to user error - I lent the camera to someone who didn't lock the battery flap before taking it into the water.The second still works and has been my regular water vacation camera for a few years.  It still works fine.I bought this one because it was a significant improvement over my old 8010.  It was certainly worth it - while it worked.  The pictures were good.  Start up was fast.  Pictures were of fine quality.  The noise on the video is noticeable, but not worse than my old 8010.  I also don't take a lot of video with this camera, and the ones that I do are of my kids playing, and the camera noise isn't noticeable in those videos.My issue is that the build quality of this camera seems to not be even close of the old one.  My old 8010 is very solid.  I also like its cover for the lens.  This one feels like a toy.  And on day three of my vacation, the screen stopped turning on.  It now only displays a greenish haze.  I've tried resetting it, leaving the battery out, etc, but nothing seems to be working.  Also Olympus doesn't have it's troubleshooting / support area up for this camera yet.  I'm  sending it back as being defective, so hopefully I got a bum unit.  Lucky for me, I brought my old 8010 with me so I will just drop my sd card into that unit and continue taking pictures.  So no real impact to my vacation, but just something that didn't need to be dealt with.Olympus needs to make this new generation of cameras more substantial.  They also need to release all support material at the same time as releasing the product.  That's basic.

Reviews.Title: Too big and clunky and every inside shot was orangish
Reviews.Author: ebw6674
Reviews.Content: Too big and heavy for a pocket camera. Every indoor shot we took, flash on or off, was orangish. Sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Tim Fender
Reviews.Content: Lightweight, underwater, what's not to love?I wish that the menu adjustments were easier, especially underwater.  There are so many modes that setting just the right one can be a nuisance. Apart from that, and a loimited color adjustment in real time, I like it. I guess I'll have to manipulate the underwater photos afterwards.

Reviews.Title: weird
Reviews.Author: Nasandelger Namkhai
Reviews.Content: i prefer to use this camera than gopro. it suppose to be shockproof, waterproof, and dust proof. for some reason, it doesn't function normal sometimes. i just went to Maui last week, but because of this stupid camera i couldn't take the pictures that i previously planned. the record button, picture view button stopped working. now it works after everything is finished. i never ever dropped my camera before. so disappointed. not really cool.

Reviews.Title: Great rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Kristan Lepik
Reviews.Content: This camera was replacing our older Kodak Sports camera for my hubby who received this as an early Christmas present. He loves capturing all of our adventures but we don't like taking the Canon DSLR on our rougher / tougher adventures so after about 6 months of doing my research the Olympus TG-2 was the best choice for us. The specs are amazing and when we took it up on the mountain for our little girls first sledding trip it worked beautifully. We also loved the pet mode so we could actually capture pictures of our black lab looking at the camera (definitely an added bonus)! Only regret we have doesn't have anything to do with the camera but the fact that right before Christmas our home was broken into and this wonderful camera was among the items stolen, but as soon as we can we are definitely purchasing this item again to replace the stolen one because it was the perfect rugged camera for us.

Reviews.Title: Not thrilled
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed.  The zoom is actually quite poor compared to my Pentex camera.  One good point is that it does have faster shutter speed and more rapid photo taking ability for sports.  If I had to buy again though, I would not.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera.
Reviews.Author: KEITH
Reviews.Content: Purchased to take on a cruise. Used above and below water with out a hitch. Underwater videos in the Caribbean were fantastic. Sound and clarity captured moments that help us relive our first cruise together over and over. Only complaint is the battery life is not what I would expect with today's technology. Purchasing extra batteries for our Honeymoon cruise in July 2014 and can't wait to use the camera again in the blue waters of Grand Turk. Recommend this camera to everybody.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Dr. Z
Reviews.Content: Worked great for my dive trip with the case.  The delay between button and shutter is lower than normal which is nice.  Easy to use.  Underwater mode does not have enough red and manual white balance works better.  I was very excited to have GPS but it takes 3-5" with access to uninterrupted sky to get a location so that was a failure on our trip.  Never got any locations on our dives.  Nice to have a camera that will be somewhat waterproof even if the case leaked.  On our trip 2 other cameras were ruined because of this problem.  My case was great but even if it were to fail the camera would likely be OK.

Reviews.Title: Becuase of the auto focus issue
Reviews.Author: Maggie He
Reviews.Content: The camera overall is OK, built to be tough.One major drawback is the auto-focus area and settings, it is not configurable; what happened to me was, during shooting the camera would focus wherever it wanted, and there is no way you could change the green-box position.Come on, it is over $300 and now is year 2013, I had to returned it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Linda Etchells
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great step up from my old Stylus Tough Cameras I have owned previously. Videos are much better and less shake! Luv it!

Reviews.Title: a little bulkier than desired, but a good camera
Reviews.Author: Gadget Tester "Gadget Tester"
Reviews.Content: it's a bit bulkier, but otherwise a good, solid camera... also unfortunately, doesn't even come with any SD card so need to buy separate.... usually, come with a small capacity one so can at least try some photos rightaway.  the charging requires direct connect cable to camera to charge the battery... not as ideal... prefer separate charger....

Reviews.Title: Works flawlessly for the reason it was purchased.
Reviews.Author: borseth
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with the intention of being able to take it with me in the water. It has now been in several hotel swimming pools (I give it to my kids and let them snap away with it), California (Sea World, Disney, and Universal Studios), and Los Cabos in Mexico in both salt water while snorkeling and fresh water in the pools. No issues so far and the pictures in and out of water have proven to be acceptable.

Reviews.Title: great update to this camera
Reviews.Author: CoffeeGuyBoise
Reviews.Content: We have had 2 other previous models of this camera and this one is by far the best! The quick response and added features of this camera are a very nice surprise from our old ones. So many great options for your photos.  We don't go anywhere with out it!

Reviews.Title: Great rugged camera
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: The best waterproof camera i have used. Originally bought a Nikon AW110, but the picture quality was horrible. This camera takes great pictures and video, and is small enough to fit in a PFD pocket. It's quick to turn on, and time to autofocus/take the next picture is quite short.This makes It easy to grab the camera turn it on and snap a picture of an animal before you have "lost" the shot. I can't think of any negatives.

Reviews.Title: Working great in water
Reviews.Author: LetMeBeFrank
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I want a tough camera mostly for taking to the beach/in the water/rain,etc.So far it has lived up to the test (I haven't taken it deep yet, maybe a few feet right now). Pictures are great, I'm still playing around with it, I'm sure someone with more knowledge on taking pictures will be able to elaborate more, I've previously just had my phone's camera. This surpasses that a lot.Going to 4-star it because, like the other reviews say, the video recording does record some internal audio it seems of the lense adjusting (the picture is great though, which I care about more).All in all, a great purchase, can't wait to take it surfing in Nicaragua!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Partyof5
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a cruise to the Western Carribean last week. I purchased the Olympus Stylus TG-2 camera to use as our primary camera for our trip. I love my Nikon D400, but it's too bulky and not waterproof. The picture quality on the Olympus is amazing. Both indoor and outdoor pictures were super sharp and bright. Under water pictures during our snorkling excursion was amazing. Everyone who travelled with us were amazed at how sharp the pictures turned out, especially outdoor pictures. I'm asian and I've always been a fan of Sony digital cameras, just because it's Sony. I never thought about buying an Olympus camera and decided to give it a chance. This camera is awesome. If picture quality and clarity is important to you, this camera will deliver. It has other bells and whistles like GPS that I didn't try.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: jbecker
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It is simple to use and takes terrific pictures.  I highly recommend it for those that want great home and vacation pictures but are not cameral buffs. It is small, nearly indestructible, and a single battery charge lasts all day.

Reviews.Title: Works as I'd expected,
Reviews.Author: Joseph C. Mckinney
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for use in photographing outdoor activities in which my camera would probably take some abuse, such as snowboarding, whitewater paddling, beaching, camping, et cetera.
