So far this camera works pretty well. It is my first Olympus. I also have a Canon T1i DSLR and a Canon SD450 point and shoot. This camera is basically gonna replace my SD450. I've used the program auto mode, as well as many of the scene modes. Program Auto seems to work very well. Most recently I was on travel/vacation and it was cloudy and overcast most of the trip. I wasn't sure if my photos would be any good because of the relatively flat lighting, but they seemed to come out relatively bright. The scene modes appeared to work as advertised, with the exception of the panorama/autostitch function. Based on some of the stitched outputs, it seems like the autostitch functionality is doing edge detection but only at a single point, and not necessarily the most defined or strong edge. The results were clearly way-misaligned panoramas. I'm gonna stick to using Canon's photostitch utlity on a PC.

Reviews.Title: having a good time with the camera
Reviews.Author: KL
Reviews.Content: it works great in most cases.  we can take photos of a flower or bug so close we can count the hairs on its leg and see the details of a flower.  the one item not so good is on the panorama setting it make a curvature on the finish photo.  we love the way the camera tells you how far to move the camera for each shot of the panorama and then stitches the shots together.  over all a great all around camera for outdoor activities.

Reviews.Title: Tough with acceptable quality
Reviews.Author: O. Slyusarchuk
Reviews.Content: Yes, it looks tough. I tried its toughness by dropping the camera inside the box in which I received the camera.Still works. I don't what to try in on concrete, though. :)Quality is OK with the best settings for Jpeg compression.Macro is great.Noise reduction makes picture look too "plastic". But this is not an issue for good shooting conditions.Have not tried it under water yet.

Reviews.Title: Fast start nice photo definition
Reviews.Author: Luis Rivera Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Easy camera to handle, I 'm the owner of a Olympus E-510, and wanted a camera that I could take every place (beach, hiking, camping)  and the TG-2  was a good selection.

Reviews.Title: Tough Camera
Reviews.Author: Da Man
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Sri Lanka. The photos turned out great for underwater pics and just being able to do anything you want to do with it. Well while working in Afghanistan I decided to use it  film a controlled detonation and actually placed this camera pretty close. We used about 100lbs of c4 and claymores and set it off. Wow it survived. The only thing is he camera got rattled from the concussion so the film didn't process. Sorry guy's. But it still works. I accidentally broke the little latch this weekend on our canoe trip on Buffalo river thinking it would be okay from getting wet. Well guess what we tipped over twice and the camera got wet on the internal ports of the usb ports. Didn't find out till 3 hours later. Pulled the battery out and let it dry out in the trunk for the remainder of the trip. Put the battery in today ,works perfect. Just have to get the latch fixed and it will be good to go again. Oh and lost the lens adapter thing to it too. It's been through alot, and I bought for that reason. If you are really active I would consider this or Go Pro cam. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: alejandro
Reviews.Content: This is my third Olympus Tough digital camera, and this one by far is the best one, the quality of the pictures has improved same as the speed to focus and to be able to take the pictures, plus i think that this new design is cooler than the previews models.If you are looking for a water and shock proof digital camera buy this one!!!!

Reviews.Title: Preparation is needed
Reviews.Author: S. Schmidtke
Reviews.Content: O.K.  I just got the camera today and decided that I would give it a test run with the grand kids at a local aquatics center.  First, this will not replace your DSLR (Mine's a Sony A65 and I love it.)  The even though I use class 10 SD cards, the write speed of this camera is much slower than my 24 megapixel DSLR.  Further, you really need to practice the various settings before beginning taking pictures.  The camera has a learning curve.  By this I mean that not all settings allow all features.  For instance, you cannot set the auto to take multiple shots.  This means that when you attempt to capture a sequence off a water slide you have to know to set it to program and then choose one of two setting for multiple shots.  Otherwise, you get take a picture and it displays the picture for couple of seconds before allowing the next shot.However, I do not want to take my DSLR on all outings.  Given this, I can live with the trade-offs.  I'll just keep the camera in Program mode most of the time.Update:I took my grand kids to an even two weeks ago.  Since it was a conference with a children's program, I passed the camera off with the instructions to just let any kid use the camera.  All the children were in 1st through 6th grade.  I was able to upload to the Instagram website for other conference goers to see the children's perspective without worrying if the camera would be ruined.  The kids had fun playing with it and were even able to 'toy' with different modes.  The camera is definitely the right purchase for this year's planned fun.  I don't have to worry about drops, spills, rain, or other issues with young children borrowing my camera.Update:Just got back from Jamaica.  Night shots with the flash were over exposed!  I had to 'step down' the settings and adjust in various programs to get the pictures to look correct.  The camera does great as long as the flash is not needed at night.  If you are wanting a camera with a good flash for all around use, including night shots,  you might want to consider a different option.  However, the camera covered most of what I needed the past several months, so I'm not changing the number of stars.

Reviews.Title: A little heavy
Reviews.Author: Doc
Reviews.Content: A little heavy and slightly larger than some others in its class but well made and easy to use. I take it wade fishing and it took a bath in my breast pocket without mishap.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I ever had.
Reviews.Author: ARMANDO ESTUDANTE
Reviews.Content: For one third of the price you can have a really good and always ready camera, impervious to rain, immersion in sat water, dropping, dust. It does not get much better.

Reviews.Title: Liking It More Every Day
Reviews.Author: K. Rice
Reviews.Content: Sure, the TG-2 has plenty of wizbang capabilities...  pre-programmed settings to optimize various situations that range from photographing food, to lighting characteristics of portraits, night time shots, and underwater scenes.  There's also a series of special effects from which to choose that include fish eye, sparkle, pop colorization, and fragmentation.  The panoramic option has proved more useful that I might have suspected.  But in the end, it's the basics that impress me the most.  The auto setting seems to make consistently great choices that result in great photos.  No issues with questionable focus or exposure levels.  Low light scenes are rendered beautifully.  As an old science teacher, I especially enjoy the super-macro setting that practically turns the camera into a little microscope.  Battery life?  No problem.As an avid bicycle rider I wanted a camera that could ride along in a pannier without having to worry about rough rides, cold weather, or occasionally getting caught out in the rain.  After all, when looking for great photos, the best camera is the one you have with you.  The Olympus TG-2 is built for the ride.  And we haven't even discussed the video performance!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Sova "HockeyTown guy"
Reviews.Content: Bought to replace a Canon D10. Super happy with the performance.I'm not usually big on built in camera effects, but this one has some amazing choices!Took it to Riveria Maya over Christmas. Snorkeling and a couple shallow dives (60 ft )Worked great. Camera is very rugged. The only area that's a little loose is the ring over the lens.It's a aesthetic ring just to cover the threads for additional lens's so no big deal.In my opinion this is a much better camera than Canons d10 or their  latest version.If your looking for a rugged camera for almost any situation, this is it. You won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: Olympus Enthusiast
Reviews.Author: Matteo B. Gravina
Reviews.Content: This product is pretty good camera, it is somewhat of a cross brid slr and point and shoot. In addition, it's practicle, quality of picture is more than I expected. Design, function, appearance, and overall a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: On time and a great camera
Reviews.Author: Claudia
Reviews.Content: The camera is in perfect conditions, its a great camera.The only thing I add its an independent charger for battery.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Travis L. Bennett
Reviews.Content: This is a great little point and shoot camera. Very rugged and I love the fact that I can carry it around in the rain if I want to. I was a little leary of the waterproof ability at first but I tried it out in a friends pool and it worked just fine. I take it everywhere with me.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen "Kawm"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Very simple to use and it takes real nice pictures.  It has a lot of fun features to play around with when you  have the time to look.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Nicolia
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and takes great pictures.  Was not happy with taking photos with my iPhone, so bought this camera.  Am not sorry at all.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Phillip R.
Reviews.Content: My wife loves the camera and is very happy with it. fast pictures so we can get my daughter without blur:) packaged well and fast shipping.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: M. H. Self "2atonce"
Reviews.Content: absolutely in love with my camera...my kids are wondering if it is mommy proof... because so far i have taken into 4 pools, in the snow and dropped it twice... still functioning.... i did lose one of the rings on the outside... but i went on line and that is more for aesthetics... plus it is cheap plastic compared to the actual camera...Some tips (not necessarily cons...just good to know)1- it does not have an external battery charger, it is plugged into the wall.  you cannot use it at that point.2- get a back up battery and purchase an extra external charger3- I just purchased the lens...(telephoto)... will review that soon... i knew going into the purchase that it had a small zoom... but I did not buy it for that... it actually takes amazing pictures and there are tons of fun settings.4- purchase the warranty... just in case... even though it is a tough camera.,.,, SHIP happens... better safe than sorry....

Reviews.Title: This may replace my entire Nikon D90 setup
Reviews.Author: Lynda Goldstein
Reviews.Content: Well, maybe not, but I keep thinking, "what would I need the Nikon for that I can't do with this camera?" Other than extensive manual adjustments of course.My husband bought me the tg-1 in August of 2012 and I just used it on vacation in Costa Rica for the very first time.  It does everything I want and easily too. The underwater capabilities are incredible. Auto and custom settings let me set it up for just about any situation I want by simply turning the dial, so it is very fast and easy to use. I don't shoot movies so I can't comment on that.I am seriously blown away by this camera. It is heavier than the usual point and shoot but given what it can do that is a worthy trade off.I can't comment yet on image quality because I haven't unloaded the card to edit photos but they look sharp on playback.It also has an incredible macro mode which has provided endless fun.I couldn't ask for more from a camera of any type really (although raw files would be my only wish for this guy).  It's just plain fun and fast and has made our vacation a lot more enjoyable for me.If the tg2 carries on these qualities then to me this is a no-brainier purchase, especially since the price has gone down significantly since the purchase of my tg1.Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Going to get wet?  Get this camera!
Reviews.Author: R ANDREW HOLBROOK
Reviews.Content: I just took this camera on a trip to the Virgin Islands and I came back with some amazing pictures.  The pre-sets make it incredibly easy to use.  And the ability to use it in rough, wet conditions made me the envy of the day-cruise set who all had to leave their iPhones on the boat.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: rcless90mm
Reviews.Content: Great camera, quick focus and does well in low light.  Been using it in Guam for a few days now.  Note: sun screen will cause the sticker on the selector dial to fall off.  I wish it had more zoom, but how much can you squeeze into a ruggedized  compact camera.

Reviews.Title: High quality camera for outdoor vacations
Reviews.Author: Richard F Ewers
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality and durable camera.  Took it on a trip to Maui where it survived scuba diving (18 - 30ft deep), being dropped on volcanic rocks and hit against body boards during failed attempts to body surf near Hana.  No issues with batter life.  It's a nice looking piece of equipment and for the most part, very easy to use.  Only hiccup we had was not knowing to put the camera in underwater mode before scuba (has to do with the intensity of the flash) and the option was not the easiest to find.If you're looking for a rugged, quality camera and aren't scared by the price tag, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Good so far
Reviews.Author: Harold Dorr
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my son who spends considerable time in the desert and the ocean doing research in demanding environments.  Easy to use, takes clear photos above and below water, and it hasn't broken yet.  He likes it.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Rusev
Reviews.Content: waterproof. Automatic works well and quickly. Versatile, stylish, GPS, a stabilizer, a great photo in macro and micro conditions. Photo quality was a pleasant surprise. Brilliance is not inferior to my SLR.

Reviews.Title: Happy with it
Reviews.Author: Dave also
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed the camera's features so far (haven't put the waterproof part to the test yet) but it wuality pics and good features.  Spend the extra $$ and get the wide lens with it!!  Worth the extra money for that lens.  Would buy again and am looking forward to putting it under water!!

Reviews.Title: Olympus nailed it with this one!!!
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: WOW. How I love it let me count the ways! Picture,ease of use,movie recording,FAST at start up,fast lens,all great. I have other things to do today so I can't go on and on but this is like having a mini DSLR in your pocket. Can't wait to get the lenses that go with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Neil "Girl in training"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take along on my more adventurous outing. Works great in water and takes awesome water pictures. No more " oh no don't get it wet!" It has some real cool features. Love the micro setting and rapid fire setting.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: LOVE MY UNDER WATER, FAST MOVING, STILL PICTURES! I RESEARCHED CAMERAS AND OPTED FOR THIS ONE GLAD I DID1 GOOD QUALITY!

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: vanessa
Reviews.Content: We love this camera for the waterproof feature and for the compactness.  It is light and still takes great pictures. I was afraid that we would be sacrificing quality when we purchased this camera because it was such a better price than the other waterproof cameras that are comparable.  I was greatly surprised with the great quality of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I expected, okay, a little more...
Reviews.Author: Dewayne Chriswell
Reviews.Content: I had been wondering about which point and shoot could go out with me camping, endure exposure to the outdoors and still produce some very good images.  After checking out a couple of review sites, I decided to take a chance on the TG-2.  I was not disappointed.  I have still not used the video functions, this isn't a big priority for me.  But the quality of the stills was even more than I expected.  A great point-and-shoot with the versatility to give you quality images in almost any environment.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: enunez
Reviews.Content: Short sweet and to the point:Pro:  Takes excellent pics in all weather and underwater, durable (my kids have dropped it and still works great)Cons: Sometimes takes a while to process pics (depending on your setting)

Reviews.Title: Very good camera!
Reviews.Author: Marko Kokelj
Reviews.Content: Very simple menu, a lot of functions, I love f2.0!!! Maybe a little small buttons (up, down, left, right) for underwater...

Reviews.Title: Got to Have It!
Reviews.Author: Jan Christensen
Reviews.Content: The TG2 has been a fantastic camera.  Used under water, action shots and all other variations.  Would like to try the additional lenses.  Its the one camera you can use for any ocassion.

Reviews.Title: The best!
Reviews.Author: L. Arantes "Brazilian Family"
Reviews.Content: Great photos, bright colors, under water and outside too. We took pictures in the sea, water parks, on sunny and rainy days, outside and inside places. It's really an amazing camera!

Reviews.Title: Easy camera
Reviews.Author: Tracy Williams
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use but on some of the settings are a little misleading.  Does work well for a small point and shoot, took it to the beach, very easy to clean afterwards.  Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Philip A Burns
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to hawaii and used it in the pool and the ocean. It did freeze once but a quick power down and it was alright. Some really amazing pictures very clear with some really cool filters. Picures and video in and out of the water were absolutely amazing!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Cpt. Howard D. Horton
Reviews.Content: I have had great luck with this camera.  The battery life has not been an issue for me.  You can just knock about and not have to worry about it.  Great pictures, nice effects, and makes a poor photographer look good.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Nicole Robards
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a sailing vacation in the British Virgin Islands and I am so glad that I did.  I looked at several different cameras and settled on this one because of the consistently high ratings.  It came in very handy on our trip because we could use it in or out of the water with great results.  It seems I need to take a closer look at the settings in order to learn how to optimize the pictures for all different types of shots.  The low light shots seemed to be a little blurry.

Reviews.Title: great underwater photos
Reviews.Author: Ellie Schmidt
Reviews.Content: Great, crisp, colorful photos underwater. Above water it leaves some to be desired, and for some reason my lens ring and the mode dial on my camera spontaneously fell off. Still works, and I am working to get it fixed.Overall, I would recommend to anyone trying to take nice photos underwater.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: John M. Praskey "johnp3350"
Reviews.Content: I had a olympus tg but wanted a newer version that had a faster start up And shorter cycling time between pictures this camera has both features , it takes great pictures

Reviews.Title: Waterproof ok, picture so so, decoration ring awful
Reviews.Author: Winter
Reviews.Content: Good:I purchased this for rafting.  The waterproof function is perfect!  Love this waterproof function.Average:The picture is just so so.  As it's using a 1/2.3 CCD, and not carl zeiss lens, the picture quality is not as good as my canon ixus 980 (1/1.7ccd, carl zeiss lens) I purchased in 2008.  The picture noise is obviously stronger than my canon.Bad:Decoration rings are easily getting loose from camera.  In 2 of my trips, me and my wife lost the original red ring and the backup black ring without even knowing when or how they got loose.

Reviews.Title: sleek
Reviews.Author: pervezb
Reviews.Content: fantastic camera, only one way to describe it, real rugged and sleek, good results and outclasses anything in its price range

Reviews.Title: It's TOUGH!
Reviews.Author: Trista Sigler
Reviews.Content: This camera is all that they say it is.  I really love it so far.  I accidentally took it to 70 ft! I forgot it was in my BC pocket from a shallow dive.  It didn't work for a whole week after that and I thought it was dead.  But suddenly it started working again and shooting great pics.  Now that is tough.

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater macro shots
Reviews.Author: Entomohomo
Reviews.Content: The "super macro" mode with LED flash is fantastic, especially for underwater macro shots. I use this for snorkeling and tidepooling, as well as for photographing insects and plants. The camera is very sturdy and lives up to its name. I bought it because it was one of the few underwater point-and-shoot cameras whose reviews didn't mention leaking or water damage as one of the problems, whereas many of the other "underwater" cameras seem to have frequent issues with leaking. We previously bought a cheaper olympus underwater camera (one of the earlier stylus "tough" cameras) and had to get it replaced twice because of leaking.

Reviews.Title: Splendid camera
Reviews.Author: federico orsini
Reviews.Content: It have a lot of functions, all in a really solid case, and the super macro is fantastic, really super....

Reviews.Title: Nope
Reviews.Author: Happypoppeye
Reviews.Content: Well, the fast lens is nice but it's not the only f/2 waterproofer (which a lot of people say it is) - the Pentax WG-3 also has the f/2 lens.Relative to every other waterproof compact I've used (Nikon aw100, Sony tx20 and Panasonic ts20) it's really big and bulky. It's twice the price I bought any of the aforementioned waterproof compacts for and honestly, I would put the TG-2 at the bottom of the pile in the IQ department (by a big margin). Noise reduction is terrible, yet high ISO shots look fairly reasonable (most probably because of the NR). This pretty much negates the lens in my opinion as it doesn't matter how good the lens is if every shot is going to have massive smudging noise reduction applied.Another thing I noticed is the loud zooming of the lens, especially in video, where as every other waterproofer I've used has a virtually silent lens. (No ticking though - aka TG-1 video).LCD is nice. Camera looks great. I returned it. No way worth the money compared to cameras half the price or less out there right now. I am going to give it a one star ...thinking about a two star, but honestly, too much money, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Not the USA Model
Reviews.Author: Gregg Creehan
Reviews.Content: This is this camera but not the USA Model it is a gray market model.  I would rather have paid more money and got the model intended to be sold in the states.  I am disappointed with Amazon for allowing this vender to sell on there sight without give that information on the sight. In general I have been happy with Amazon, but they are slipping very fast.  This is the second item I received in the past three months that has not lived up to the write-up.  Due to the fact that I bought it for my daughter to take on her trip I can not return it.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: received for Christmas and have not used underwater yet but on land pictures are amazing.  What an excellent purchase for a tough, take everywhere camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Dianna "Dianna"
Reviews.Content: The pictures were not as sharp as I expected.  However, I am use to using a Nikon DSL.  I believe my rating and review are influenced by a comparison I made between the two cameras.  Therefore my rating probably reflects a biased view.

Reviews.Title: Screen cracked
Reviews.Author: nihayet ersoy
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son's BD at the end of  April 2013. During one of our trip screen cracked in the padded backpack. We have no idea how it happened. I tried  to contact to Olympus, but the person on the phone asked me to fill the document online. I guess we have warranty, but to send the camera back I need to pay over 120 $.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, Not Perfect
Reviews.Author: DS
Reviews.Content: I was really torn between the Olympus TS2 and the Panasonic TS5. I ended up going with the TS2. The camera itself feels very sturdy and takes very nice photos. The underwater photos taken in the pool are just amazing. We'll see how the ocean pictures turn out at the end of the month.Concerns: Recording video has the buzzing noise others have complained about. It's annoying but not a deal breaker for me. The other issue i noticed was after handling my snorkel gear i couldn't spin the picture mode dial, my hands were too slippery.If you plan on recording a lot of video with this camera, then you might wanna pass. The doors with the dual latch system seem VERY solid.4stars for a good camera. -1 for the video issues

Reviews.Title: So So.  Focus is terrible.
Reviews.Author: BrianD
Reviews.Content: I received the camera in the last week of February as a pre-order.  It arrived sooner than expected and in time for vacation.  I just returned from a week in the Caribbean where we used it for mostly underwater photography and some nighttime dinner shots.  There were a surprising number of still shots that were out of focus.  Also the underwater photos are very dependent on the setting you choose, admittedly I'm still trying to figure this out.  Some were dead on, where as others lacked contrast and the white balance was terrible.  I think the camera has potential to take good underwater shots, just experiment, but the most disappointing thing being the poor focusing.

Reviews.Title: Great all-around camera
Reviews.Author: Ashley A.
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! Very durable. I just wish it would have come with a screen protector. Takes excellent pics though!!

Reviews.Title: Christmas 2013
Reviews.Author: Carol Creamer
Reviews.Content: Just got this as a Christmas gift from my husband. So far the pics are great. True test will be at the beach and on our cruise.

Reviews.Title: Spendy with no regrets
Reviews.Author: Chuckie Ferranti
Reviews.Content: Picture quality? Awesome. Ease of use? Like buttah... Movie quality? Check. Underwater stills and movie - booyeah. Why not 5 stars? Clicking during underwater video.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife for vacation. Easy to operate, fast lens, and tough enough for my wild women.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: MasterCadillac
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  The macro function is incredible--I was able to take amazing close-ups of a hermit crab in its shell.  The bells and whistle settings are actually pretty good and the panoramic setting is the best I've ever seen.  I was disappointed when I scraped view finder on day 2 of ownership when I brought it on a kayak trip (isn't it supposed to be ultra-rugged??) but otherwise I'm really happy with the quality.

Reviews.Title: Great for snorkeling
Reviews.Author: Unpeachy
Reviews.Content: I live in Hawaii and spend a lot of time at the beach.  This camera is perfect for snorkeling and so far I haven't had any trouble using it under water.  It has some fun settings and some manual capabilities.  It has a setting for aperture but it doesn't have one for shutter speed.  Most of my pictures come out crisp and clear.  A little over priced in my opinion, but overall a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Met my expecttions.
Reviews.Author: GZeus
Reviews.Content: I am really pleased with this camera so far.  While the pictures are not as good as a DSLR they are as good or better than most point and shoots that I have used in the last few years; excellent outdoors and pretty good in low light situations as well.  I have had it in the pool and the ocean (swimming not diving) and it has been just fine so far.  I bought it for its tough features but having used it a few times I can say that I would have been just as pleased with its performance even if it wasn't rugged - that is just a bonus but a bonus that you pay for.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: Jozilla
Reviews.Content: great photos, kinda pricey. I love being able to use it with lenses with adapters and as a pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: G. Raney
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my son who is using it on a back-packing trip in Alaska.  He loves it.  Great photos, great features, and great special effects...

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Leslie A. Baskett
Reviews.Content: But its not that easy to use and im having problems with folders from my iphoto but i think it is operator error. The instructions could be a little more user beginner friendly. Other that that its a nice camera

Reviews.Title: Really, Olympus??
Reviews.Author: Sukie Tawdry "SukieTawdry"
Reviews.Content: I just unpacked my TG-2 and was very disheartened to see multiple cables & cords. I bought the camera because it's highly rated for low light situations and is water/dust-proof and shock resistant. If it performs as advertised, I will be happy to upgrade my rating. But for now, I'm most unhappy with the rigmarole for charging the battery. The battery charges inside the camera and you must connect the camera to the battery charger via USB cable and then connect the charger to the USB-AC adapter. All are proprietary. So, what's the big deal? Well, I'm a frequent traveler and as all travelers know, the amount of crap we have haul around to keep our computers, notebooks, cameras, MP3 players, Kindles, phones, etc charged is absurd. The last thing I want in a new camera is three more pieces of auxiliary equipment to pack and track. My other cameras (Canon and Panasonic--this is my first Olympus) have small chargers that plug directly into the power source. Is there a good reason why Olympus can't follow suit? I realize it's a relatively minor matter, but it was enough that I seriously considered returning the camera.1/26/14 update: I bought spare batteries and a plug-in charger, so that problem is solved. However, I finally got around to charging and installing a battery & the camera doesn't function. When the battery is inserted, the camera makes a grinding sound and the screen lights up but after a few seconds, it beeps several times and shuts itself off and then makes some more grinding sounds. Once the battery is installed, it won't turn on at all, just makes those grinding sounds. I've tried all three batteries. The rating goes down accordingly to one star.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money, we'll see after failed product sent to manufacture.
Reviews.Author: Dave K
Reviews.Content: Took into ocean many times while on vacation and guess what? Yes it took on water. How, where? No idea all the locks where locked, everything was secure. But my heart sank when I was snorkeling and seen the screen produce disortion and then go out. I let the camera dry out and pulled the battery and card as soon as I got out of hte water. But no luck it is waterlogged. Olympus was great in their service so far. I do mean so far, I had to send it back in for warrenty repair. Yes it is covered under factory and of course I bought a 2 year square deal warranty from amazon. So we'll see what Olympus says. Still waiting, it has only been 7 business days, you are to give them 10 days to look at and inspect. The card is ok I uploaded my video and pics when I got home. Pics are great quality and the video is wonderful. I was not the only one who had trouble, a few divers with their gopro also had issues even having the outer case, it still filled with water. I don't think there is a water proof camera out there. Can someone prove me wrong?Haven't taken into ocean yet have taken and used at a event, many feaatures to choose from. takes great shots in huge formats , make sure you have a card large enought to handle. Taken a few upclose shots and the auto setting handles with ease. The action setting is good, can not totally give a accurate description of every setting but uploads to my mac with no problems.

Reviews.Title: No Memory Card Included
Reviews.Author: Patricia L. Torres
Reviews.Content: I don't order a new camera very often and I was very disappointed that this camera did not include the Memory Card.  I would have included it in the order but there was no mention of it not being part of the purchase.  Now, if I order it separately, I will have to pay shipping or do down to my local camera shop and try to find it. I've never had a camera that didn't come ready to take pictures.  The third party seller was "Reliable Business Partners" - be warned!

Reviews.Title: Biggest Disappointment In a Long Time
Reviews.Author: Systems Engineer
Reviews.Content: When using this overpriced paperweight, I found that it was very easy and common to inadvertently put your left finger over the stereo microphones on the top completely trashing the sound for your video.  If you zoom in or out while taking a video, an unbelievably load motor whine is recorded and heard on the video when it is played back.  Even after the zoom stops, there are still strange electronic noises that linger in your video for maybe 3 or 4 seconds.  The still pictures had a strange orange fuzzy hue...no matter what I tried, I could not make them any sharper or clearer.

Reviews.Title: Great, while it worked
Reviews.Author: Simple is Better
Reviews.Content: I thought that my camera had suddenly died for no reason, not sure how it happened but someone took the battery out and, since Olympus doesn't design very well, turned the battery around. There is no way to tell which way the battery goes by looking at the shape of the battery, I have to look at the connectors and make sure they are lined up correctly.made for a long, fun weekend of mountain biking with zero pictures from one of the most beautiful places on earth, Lake Tahoe.

Reviews.Title: This is a piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: this camera wouldn't even charge. I had to return it as there was a problem with the camera not getting power.  I think this is a junk.

Reviews.Title: Product was defective upon arrival
Reviews.Author: Kenneth J. Foppiano
Reviews.Content: I'm sure the TG2 is a good product; but the TG2 I rec'd would not work, right out of the box! The monitor would not light up. All it did was show printed info. You couldn't take a picture, use the telefoto lens, use the menu, etc.  Unfortunately, I didn't attempt to use the camera until a month after I rec'd it from Amazon; and so I couldn't send it back to Amazon for replacement. I had to send it Oympus, instead, under the warranty. I hope they can repair or replace it for me.  I feel foolish for not testing the camera right away upon its arrival; but we wanted to wait for our anniversary before we used it.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus TG-2 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Bruno Heidik
Reviews.Content: It is a bit too complicated. I thought the settings would be mostly automatic but a bit more skill is needed that I must get.Also, the 4x zoom could have had a built is 7x zoom (tele-converter lens) instead of the 4x zoom, The Fish Eye Lens would then be the only attachment.

Reviews.Title: Revew
Reviews.Author: d c******
Reviews.Content: I like the Hi-Definition video.I always buy Olympus.I am planning to buy the telephoto and wide angle lenses for this camera.

Reviews.Title: BETTER THAN THE DSLR
Reviews.Author: Erik 420
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best camera on the market right now and the price is hundreds if not thousands less than its competitors. This camera competes with and smashes on the latest Digital SLR cameras.This camera...will fit in your pocket, a DSLR cannot.-can be dropped from 7 feet, good luck with your DSLR.-is water proof, there is no chance your DSLR will hold up to water.-The manufacturers want you to get your DSLR wet because they are designed to break. Thus they'll make a quick thousand off of you when you buy a replacement.-is freeze-proof, very useful if you want to take pictures on a snowy day or leave it in the car overnight on a cold night.-is dust proof, well just watch what happens to your DSLR if you get some saw-dust on there, it probably won't turn on anymore.-is also crush proof, apparently a 220 pound person could stand on this thing and it's fine.My last point and shoot camera was the Canon G10 which easily performed the same way as a DSLR and I'd say this camera takes equal pictures to that, with a little bit less control.The button placement is all correct, and the internal computer is very good.COMPLAINTS:The only complaints I have about this, compared to that, are that it lacks Manual mode and Shutter-Speed priority mode.This won't be your ideal camera to take out and do a long exposure of the stars.It also has C1 and C2 on its wheel style mode selector, that DO NOT SAVE. (Or I have yet to figure out how)Pretty annoying when I want my custom modes to exclude flash and every time I turn the thing on I have to shut off the flash.Normally cameras also have built in option to change the pictures colors (such as sepia, or B&W;), this doesn't have that.I have had difficulty doing ANYTHING with the videos. For some reason Olympus doesn't want you to be able to import them to your computer, or to the internet, you may only view them on the camera or in Olympus Viewer. What the ****? I'm sure there is a way around it but they sure don't make it easy because I have yet to find the proper solution.If you consider yourself a photographer of any caliber, I recommend this to you. You WILL find it replacing your DSLR.Don't catch yourself saying "I wish I brought my camera." This one you can bring with you everywhere.

Reviews.Title: All Purpose Camera
Reviews.Author: C. L. Henry "Carol H."
Reviews.Content: As an all-purpose camera, it is very poor.  Not enough zoom.  Will use it for snorkeling in 3 weeks.  Perhaps it will be good for that, but very disappointed so far.

Reviews.Title: WASTE OF MONEY :: Images and audio sound is terrible
Reviews.Author: ALYOUNT
Reviews.Content: WASTE OF MONEYWhat a crappy camera. The worse part of the camera is the audio on the movies. It's absolutely ridiculous that this is an issue. You'd think it would be a simply software fix but this is crazy. The TG-1 had the same problem and it's not being fixed. I guess this is what you get when you buy NON USA.The quality of the image is really not that good unless the lighting is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Yet to be decided...
Reviews.Author: New user
Reviews.Content: I honestly can't say that I can give a very helpful review at this point. I haven't used the camera enough. So far I've had no problems.

Reviews.Title: Super!
Reviews.Author: David Backman
Reviews.Content: Worked like a charm.  Used it for general and underwater photography in Hawaii.  Not too heavy or too big.easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Won't turn on...
Reviews.Author: Tigerknighton
Reviews.Content: Super Unhappy! Received my camera today and it won't turn on. No indicator light, no screen, nothing.I hope this doesn't happen to a lot of people.
